description:
I remember first trying Tamarind Hall when they catered a work lunch awhile back at our office. 

I remember noticing how bright and colorful the dishes were  - and even though I had already eaten lunch - I figured I'd try a little of the fantastic looking spread.

As soon as I had one bite - I was smitten. Tamarind's pumpkin curry was incredible. It was light, but bursting with lovely flavor. Their papaya salad was also wonderful and full of fresh vegetables. I was so enamored by the food that I made sure to make a mental note to use them for a big annual work event that was coming up.

As the event neared, I made sure to reach out to Tamarind Hall well in advance. Salisa was amazing from start to finish. She eased all of my worries when it came to quantities of food as well as executing both vegan and gluten free dishes.

For the big event we ordered their Platha Dip with three curry sauces, their Thai Pumpkin Curry, their Prig King and their coconut rice. Salisa made sure to be there for the delivery the night of and her and her staff even brought flowers to adorn the food display. It was evident how much she cares about making sure her customers thoroughly enjoy their experience with Tamarind Hall.

The Thai Pumpkin Curry was dreamy with Kabocha squash submerged in creamy, bright orange coconut curry made with tangy kaffir lime leaves, wild ginger, lemongrass and Thai chilis. The Prig King was full of fresh green beans and other assorted vegetables (Salisa was kind enough to add them) in a fragrant sauce, and the coconut rice was divine.

Everyone at the event who tried the stunning looking spread was impressed. Everything tasted so fresh and it was all so beautiful.

I have yet to actually visit Tamarind Hall's physical location for a meal (I definitely plan on it though) - but if you ever need fantastic catering for an event - please do not hesitate to order from here. 

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Service was slow to come take our order but the food was great. Good portions for the curry, I like that it had a lot of meat. Very flavorful. Beware extra rice is nearly $3... too much IMO 

My friend didn't enjoy $17 for a few piece of chicken and rice.
author: Vicky T.

description:
First off, I did not even know that King of Thai got replaced by Tamarind Hall until I ate here last Saturday.  I am sad that they closed off the upstairs, because it was a really cool aspect of this place.  I felt that when you went upstairs, you were able to lounge around with friends, and they could care less.  

I came here with a party of six for dinner and we were seated immediately .  I do recommend that this place invest in some new furniture because a lot of us just sank into in the chairs for lack of any cushion.  We were helped by Lisa who was super friendly and fun.  We decided on family style where we would order a bunch of things and share everything.  We ordered the garlic fries, very healthy fresh rolls, fried calamari, curry for 3, pad see ew, fried chicken over fried rice, garlic dungeness crab and noodles, omelet wrapped pad thai, and the garlic pork ribs.

All the food was absolutely delicious.  Everything tasted fresh, full of flavor, and was served piping hot.  The service was really good.  They checked on us constantly and helped us clear empty dishes to make room as soon as we finished them.  

My only recommendation for food would be to add add more roti in the curry for 3 appetizer.  We were left with 75% of the curry and no naan to dip it with.  My other suggestion is new chairs.  Other than that, I would recommend if you like Thai food.  I will be back.
author: Victor L.

description:
Really good Thai place that's not in the tenderloin. It's been hard to find a decent authentic place that isn't a venture into the tenderloin area. This one is in north beach area. 

Really hip and modern place. Ambiance was cool and bar area looked pretty cool. The staff there is so nice and attentive. 

We ordered the Khao Koo Kapi which is a rice cooked in shrimp paste with egg, sweet pork, mango slices, chilies, etc all neatly laid out. Really flavorful and not that many restaurants carry this. Reminds me of my mom's homemade version. Also had the Tom yum soup which was really good as well. Lastly even though it's not thai, we had the garlic noodles with fresh crab because we had been craving this. Oh and of course they have Thai beers. 

Overall good place. First time here and will be back.
author: Melissa L.

description: This is an awkward place to have Thai food in the heart of North Beach. The restaurant is located in backstreets of NorthBeach. I was in the mood for Thai and I found this place. I enjoyed their chicken fried rice. satay shrimp, and soup. I like the inside decor and the service was good.
author: Juan V.

description:
Great option for Thai food in North Beach.

We went on a Thursday night around 6:30 and plenty of tables were available. The dining room filled up a little more as the evening wore on.

The restaurant is chic, the chairs were comfortable, and tables were big enough and spaced apart well.

Service is friendly, and we were able to order happy hour specials from our table (ends at 7 M-F!)

Food is solid. We ordered the healthy spring rolls with mango, avocado, and some other items wrapped up in lettuce to start (Happy hour $6), as well as the Pad See Ew with chicken and the Salmon Curry.  All were good, but I wish that they had other options for the yellow curry (besides salmon), as it is the mildest curry available. We also got a couple glasses of house wine (red and white) for $5 off the happy hour menu, and they were A-OK!

I'll probably be back, especially since when I checked in on Yelp I was awarded a free Thai Iced Tea with the purchase of an entree!
author: Roya B.

description: Loved this spot when I first moved to SF about 2 yrs ago. But now it's gone downhill a little. Still love their pumpkin curry but think they need to consider lowering prices / minimizing the menu a bit. Wish they had just a few stellar things than a ton of things that were only ok.
author: Emily M.

description:
Showed up around 7pm on a weekday and there wasn't a wait, although it looked like it was starting to get crowded. 

My friend and I ordered curry with tofu and pad Thai with tofu. This was definitely a great spot in terms of authentic Thai food. While my pad Thai was tasty, I wish I'd left my comfort zone a bit and ordered something less traditional.

Price point seemed really fair for SF and should've been incentive for me to try something tastier - I'll have to come back sometime!
author: Amy C.

description:
Great food.
The garlic pork ribs were great with garlicky flavored sauce. The drunken chicken noodles was delicious as well.
author: Kairav P.

description: Really like this place! Pad see yew was really good with chicken. I've also had the crab fried rice, drunken noodles, spicy wings (forget their name) and curry. Will definitely return. I've dined in and gotten take out and have been impressed each time!
author: Rosie L.

description:
First yelp review in years because of such an annoying experience at Tamarind Hall.

My two times there have been extremely inconsistent. The first time was OK but it was literally just my friend and I at the bar and the restaurant was practically empty. 

Went back a week later when it was busier and man was it a disaster.

- horrible service (guy would take drink orders with half the table and not finish going around, I had to call him twice to actually take my order too). Food came out at very different times for all 8 of us (one friend didn't have his simple dish meanwhile everyone else was already done eating as it was getting cold. Random and inconsistent service: we ask for 3 IPAs and get two different beers. Instead of just fixing this simple mistake, the waiter would attempt to argue with us.. DUDE, just bring us IPAs and let's get over it! 

- bad food: I really hate to say this because I wanted to like the place. But it tasted blend for me and outright bad for some of my friends' dishes. Some left hungry without barely eating anything on their plate.

- when we got the bill the 18% gratuity has been automatically added since we were 8. Since we literally had bad food and shitty service, we complained and asked if we could enter in our own tip since we had absolutely not been satisfied with anything. INSTEAD of apologizing or trying to understand what they had done wrong and try to solve the situation, the waiter argued with me and never once apologized. He even argued about the food and said "WHO didn't like the food??" To which half of the table answered.

Bonus shitty point for the water glasses not rinsed well and tasting like soap/product.

Never coming back here..
author: Alexandre T.

description: I've always went to Thai restaurants with high expectations given the few times I've been fortunate enough to enjoy some home cooked Thai food. Experiences at most of these places fell flat as it seemed they were stingy with the seasonings. Moreover, I've know Thai cuisine to be filled with fresh produce. Tamarind Hall nailed it on all fronts. The food I enjoyed was full of freshness and flavor. Complex flavors that come together nicely. The heat complimented the meat. Fresh and varied produce to balance it out. I highly recommend and will make Tamarind one of my regular destinations. My taste buds have been to Bangkok.
author: Oakland O.

description: Such yummy food. Not sure if there is a single mediocre item on the menu. Try the Duck noodle bowl or the Salmon curry. Both are delicious. Plus the prices are not crazy. YAY!
author: Lillian W.

description: The space is really nice. It looks sort of like two separate stores were bought by one owner and a wall was knocked down to form one restaurant. There is a distinct bar area with a few tables and a separate entrance. There is also a more traditional restaurant side. We have visited twice so far. Once just for dessert- we got the mango sticky rice. Around $10 and good but standard. We also came once for dinner. We got the pumpkin curry and kee mao. Nothing really stood out. It wasn't the best thai we ever had but not the worst. I will go back again if I happen to be in the area and sotto mare is too long to wait for. The free thai iced tea through yelp check-in was a nice touch.
author: Steph C.

description: Cozy atmosphere.   Great tasting food.  Prompt service.  Came during happy hour and took advantage of their drink special ($5 well drinks) and had an order of their hot wings....delicious!  Soup was tasty and the shrimp was fresh.   The drunken noodle dish was good too.
author: Angie D.

description:
Oh Tamarind Hall....how I miss you! I recently changed jobs and am not able to go back for lunch anymore sadly. Luckily, my coworkers still work close so I am able to request that we go here for lunch! 

What can I say about this place? The owner, oh my gosh the owner. I never got her name but she is one of the nicest people I've ever met! She's so sweet and attentive to her guests. Every time I go there, she's always super nice and excited about her food. Everything that I've tried is amazeballs. From their chicken wings to their salmon plate to their duck noodle, everything is beyond flavorful! I'm drooling just typing this out. I seriously want to stop by the next time I'm in the city! 

The decor is beautiful too! The first time I walked in, I was in awed at how the place is furnished. Only small gripe is, their chairs is a bit unexpecting. I would sit down thinking that it'l be a hard surface but I usually sink which gives me a surprise. All in all, if I could give this place a 10, I would but 5 stars will have to do. I can't wait to stop by again!
author: Denise L.

description: My family and I stumbled on this place and it was a treasure, now it wasnt packed. But i noticed the bartender was doing everything! a little bothered ,by not being tended to but I could appreciate the HUSTLE to make sure everyone was attended to. Needless to say the bartender was the owner and comped us drinks, which  a plus .she also was very polite and has a great energy the food was fantastic , it was a a great time and were in town for a couple of days and this Definately was a memory saved! Shout out to celisa from new jersey!
author: Carlos B.

description:
I really enjoyed eating here and the food was fantastic and the portions are huge but something has to be done about the way they check guests in, especially those that had made reservations beforehand. 

We came on a Friday night with an 8:30pm reservation. Right as I walked in, I could tell this place was bumpin' with patrons so you know it must be good!

 The layout was confusing and not just puzzling to me but to all those that came after me. Usually restaurants have the register or check-in table and hostess somewhere near the front of the establishment but Tamarind Hall's was in the middle left hidden amongst the tables. I didn't exactly understand the protocol here but I realized that because the place is so busy and there was only 2 waiters bussing the entire place, you have to be swiftly go in the middle near the register and wait for one of the waiters in grey to pass you by so you can flag them and tell them you want to check in. Despite having an 8:30pm reservations, we weren't seated until 9pm or so. 

We were seated in the way back near the bar area behind a tree. It was sort of hard to flag waiters down when you're hidden in the black shadows. 

Regardless, the food here was amazing! Granted, I only tried the two most mainstream Thai dishes you can get: pad see yew and pad thai. The portions were huge!! Flavoring was also on point. The pad thai was beautifully cradled inside an omelet shell and you have a choice between beef, pork, chicken, or shrimp. 

I would definitely come back to try their other menu offerings but maybe on a less busy night where I don't have to flag people so many times just to grab their attention. Perhaps on busier nights they should hire more manpower to accommodate.
author: Connie M.

description:
Beautiful plates with nice surprises of flavor, texture  and color. Still slowly figuring out how to get around.SF I met some High School friends for lunch. They accept reservations but we were the only guests on a Saturday at noon. We were so chatty as this was a reunion of sorts but the service seemed slow to me.

Take that with a grain of salt , because since we were chatting up a storm ,  we had not even looked at the menu when the server first checked. After that he used that as the pace we were comfortable with but I am just used to being checked on more frequently especially when the place is quiet.

Typically at Thai restaurants the dish they serve with pride is the Pad Thai, but we all seemed ready to venture to other dishes. I had the Beef Jerky which alone was unremarkable but that sauce tho..and add that sticky rice! It was the perfect portion for my meal. 

The Salmon ceviche beautifully tender and delicious, the prettiness of the dish alone forced a photo. 

the Thai salad a sort of Pad Thai without most of the noodles and sauce. Light yet filling. Wrapping the toppings with lettuce is the way to go here. 

We drank water the whole time but I could see a Full Bar in the back. 

I'm not sure what else is to do in the area but the trip to meet old friends over a leisurely delicious meal was definitely worth it.
author: Marcy H.

description:
Tamarind Hall is my happy place and absolute go-to when I'm tasked with picking the dinner spot for a group of friends. This is definitely my favorite place for Thai food in SF! They have an impressively extensive menu and the coziest of interiors (hello Christmas lights all year round), and serve up incredibly flavorful and unique Thai food at an affordable price. 

I get the happiest vibes walking in - this neighborhood gem is casual and dimly lit and situated on Grant street in the quaint area of North Beach. Service is attentive and friendly - no complaints here :). 

On to the food! The menu is massive and can therefore be overwhelming. My suggestion is to order several apps if your party is small in order to try a lot and share, tackle the mains if you're ambitious, or do a mix and match :). Here's some of my faves:

Thai-Style Fish Cake (appetizer - $10.95): This dish first off looks beautiful but secondly it is so delicious! The fish cakes are spiced really well and pair well with the sweet chili sauce that comes with it. Super delectable!

Curry-osity (appetizer - $11.95): Two words - get this! The dish comes with 5 different curries / dipping sauces, each wonderfully flavorful, and pieces of roti pratha to dip in the curries. The pratha is buttery and delicious! We ended up asking for more pratha and then when that was done we kept the curries to have and add to our other dishes, like the fried rice.

Pad See You (main - $10.95): My brother in law orders Pad See You/Ew every single time he eats at a Thai restaurant and he said this is the best one he has had. Far too often this dish can be bland and underwhelming, but this one was perfect and not dry either! I absolutely loved it and thought the noodles were cooked perfectly.

Dungeness Crab Fried Rice (main - $15.95): This dish comes out with a good-sized heap of crab on top of the rice and boy is the crab FRESH. The rice has beautifully subtle flavors, with the flavor profile increasing when you add the light and lovely chicken broth. We really liked this dish just because it was simple and fresh. 

I cannot wait to try more things here and will keep coming back with groups! They take reservations on Yelp and they are usually easy to come by! So if you're in a pickle on a busy night, head here but really just go here regardless :). Friendliest and tastiest Thai spot!
author: Sabina S.

description: We went after a very long week and I tried the pork neck (house speciality), it's was a very good experience. One of the best porks! I highly recommend this place!
author: Mauricio C.

description: Went for lunch on a weekday with good friends. wasn't crowded and seated well. We ordered chicken wings, drunken noodle, and Yellow Salmon curry. Chicken wings are a Bomb and finger licking delicious, Drunken noodles came out good, gravy of Salmon curry was good but the salmon itself wasn't cooked well. Overall good food and ambiance.Would comeback to try omelet wrapped pad thai and ofcourse chicken wings
author: Kira N.

description:
Really not very good Thai food.

I ordered two appetizers,  the pork neck house favorite and the 5 curries with Nan.
The pork was really fatty, worse than bacon kind of fat.
The Nan was like a bad crepe.

I also ordered the beef with egg plant.  The beef was not tender.

I will not be back.
author: Doris A.

description:
Came here for date night on a Thursday evening with reservations and served disappointment after disappointment.

Food
-  Curry Sampler (Happy Hour $6, normally $13)- three tiny servings of curry sauce and half a paratha, split into 4. The paratha wasn't enough to enjoy even one of the sauces. I'd recommend providing a lot more dipping bread if you're going to charge $13. 
- Omelette Pad Thai- never even showed up, after following up 30 min into our meal, he asked what what kind of pad thai we ordered... logistics and serve time can be greatly improved; we ended up cancelling this item because i was done with my whole entree and we needed to leave
-Green Curry with Chicken ($14)- The chicken was overcooked and tasteless. The plating made it difficult to enjoy rice and curry at the same time.

Ambiance
+Very chill space with TV's everywhere, gets pretty loud so dont expect to have a conversation with whoever you are there with

Service
-Slow, inattentive and rushed

Good luck to the team, hope service and food live up to the prices soon!

Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
I'm so disheartened to leave such a bad review for Tamarind Hall..Right when my girl friend and I walked in, up to the point when we received the bill everything was all bad :(( Ordered 2 Thai tea and it was watered down and flavorless. It would help if they added more creamer and tea to give the drink more flavor. As for the food, the duck noodle soup was pretty good! I wasn't so happy about the egg noodles because they were really soggy, so if you order the duck soup please request for ho fun noodles! Duck was good and wasn't too fatty and goes well with the broth. The sea bass dish was all bad :( Fish was undercooked and the noodles were soggy. I told our waitress about it and she took the whole plate and gave me a puzzled stare like I'm being difficult or something. 

Well why would anyone want to eat undercooked fish that's still frozen from the freezer??! Instead of apologizing or asking to replace the dish with something else the waitress just snatched my food, bounced to the kitchen, and didn't utter a single word. Finally, she comes out and stares at me, and I politely ask if they could replace that dish with something else. She goes back to the register to talk to the manager I assume? Then flatly tells me "NO." I was astounded and cordially explained that the dish hasn't been touched and the fish was undercooked and everything. Again she stared nonchalantly back at me and still said "NO." I was annoyed as hell at this point already and we just stared back and forth at each other confused. I've had enough of this bs at this point and asked for the check, then she finally comes back and tells me she'll knock 50% off that dish....

To keep it short. I've stepped into Tamarind Hall just to have a good meal, but I left with a nasty taste in my mouth! 

Note to restaurant: check your cooks and employees on how to serve food and customers! The last thing you want is for your customers to have some food borne illness!
author: Hang H.

description:
Resolved and adjusted rating based on excellent resolution.

This place used to be our go to takeout, until tonight. The once generous portion of curry is now half the size. When I called to complain I was told "different shape container, same amount, 28oz" thought this seemed strange so I got out the measuring cups, it's 18 oz. so disappointing

Resolved and adjusted rating based on excellent resolution.
author: Alexa R.

description:
Perfect for a laid back family dinner. Quality and tasty food in a slightly crowded but pleasant environment. 

The portions are quite large but stay very authentic and quite delicious. The space is small so not too many people fit providing an enjoyable noise level. There are many TVs on basically every wall if you're into that. The bar serves a significant range of unusual cocktails however I recommend the whole young coconut. Definitely worth the $8. Service is extremely efficient (the entrees arrived before the starters) and the waiters are very polite. 

Recommend for any easy and casual occasion.
author: Clementine R.

description:
I was actually on a walking tour that paused outside Tamarind Hall, and I was wooed inside by the amazing aromas coming from this place. I just had to come by after my tour, and was so glad I did! 

The food is a nice change, especially in the North Beach area where majority of restaurants are Italian themed. Solid, rich flavors that made my mouth water for more. The staff is very friendly and attentive, and the ambiance inside is nicely dimmed for a great experience. Really enjoyed my meal here.
author: Sonia D.

description: NOT SAFE for people with gluten intolerance or gluten allergies.  The menu is labeled, but the wait staff said a few items were labeled incorrectly.  The items that are labeled "correctly" need heavy modifications. Upon ordering my meal, the waiter discussed my order with the kitchen and assured me everything would be fine. The food tasted like hoisin after I started eating, so I asked the waiter again, who informed me he had made a mistake and that I was eating food marinated with a gluten-containing marinade.
author: Guy G.

description:
Yes, the service here is great! So personable and friendly. But the real reason I keep coming back after so many years is that the food is delicious. My favorite is the larb with pork and a side of sticky rice. 

By the way, this place is great to go with a group of friends, the prices are fair, there's usually plenty of space and they have a full bar!
author: Christopher N.

description:
I ordered pickup off the Eat24 app and it took 30 min which wasn't too bad. When I went to pick it up around lunchtime on a weekday the whole restaurant was empty. 

I got the Pad See You and it was less than mediocre . It wasn't hot when I got it. The portion was small - my to go box was barely 3/4 full. The dish was lacking a lot of salt and flavor in general. It doesn't come with meat like other Thai restaurants and you had to pay extra for it so I went with the veggies it came with. The veggies were not fresh at all. The lettuce and broccoli were brown and not thoroughly cooked because all the veggies were pretty hard. 

I was quite disappointed because there are really good reviews but maybe I should be trying the curries and rice dishes instead. Probably won't be back because there's definitely better options in the area.
author: Kelly N.

description: excellent service! owner is warm, friendly and excellent host. the food is cooked with great flavors.  they are very passionate about food quality and service. highly recommend!
author: Richard B.

description: Went to this place for lunch and ordered their jack o lantern curry. It was gooood. A bit spicy but the curry taste great, hint of coconut cream and lots of flavor. Will definitely come back again. Staff was nice and hooked up my homie with a Thai iced tea even though he didn't check in on yelp.
author: Chan S.

description: The pregnant woman had the best customer service skills.  She was so nice and even remembered me!  She cooked my to go order specially because she knew I would have to microwave it later.  It tasted great.
author: Julia W.

description: The Thai fried rice with brown rice and tofu was fantastic. The service was very nice as well.
author: Michael R.

description: Used Tamarind Hall's catering services for a company event. We ordered the Drunken Noodles, Prik Khing with Chicken, Basil Eggplant with Tofu, Mango Salad. Everything was very tasty, but extremely oily. The food definitely hits the spot, but be ware, you will be eating ALOT of oil.
author: Jie L.

description:
We were in the city, hungry, & in search for a place to eat. This place came up with good reviews, so we decided to give it a go. We called got a reservation & were greeted right away, even though we arrived early.
The ambiance is hip & new, there is a full bar area towards the back.
We sat at the front area...I had the lychee drop, but maybe it's just me, couldn't tell there was alcohol in it, hmmm.
We ordered fish balls, chicken satay, & pad see ew with beef. All dishes we've had before at other Thai restaurants and I have to say I've had better. Something was just not doing it for me with the flavors. The presentation was nice & so was the service!
author: Nicole A.

description: I really wanted to give 4stars as the food presentation were great. Also friendly service and interior was beautifully decorated. But the curries just weren't the best, not much flavor difference between the options. I think I know thai curries, or should I say have tried many at many different Thai restaurants from NYC to Thailand. Next time I'm back in the SF area, will have to try another Thai spot.
author: Danielle G.

description: Great, fresh, delicious food! So many options and they are all delicious! They have an amazing happy hour menu with great drinks, appetizers, and much more. Had such great variety of meals. Fabulous service too! Would most definitely come back if I ever get to come back to the area!
author: Chelsea G.

description: Food, presentation, service, and ambience were amazing! A perfect thai meal to end a long day of travel.
author: Sama K.

description: The restaurant had such promise - with a punny name and great location, but when we came on a Sunday night, the service was slow (though the waitresses were kind) and the pad thai that was clearly marked non-spicy on the menu came out with chili flakes and super spicy. The waitress said nothing could be done because the sauce was pre-made. I was disappointed. As an aside, and not a dealbreaker, but the music was off-putting.
author: Jan Z.

description:
Price - very reasonable prices (~$10)
Portion sizes - huge! Definitely get a good bang for your buck
Service - a little slow 
Food - so good!

I ordered the pad see you with chicken and checked in on yelp to get a free Thai iced tea. The iced tea was delicious, nice and refreshing. Our food came out pretty quickly and very hot. The portion sizes were huge! I was amazed at how much food I was getting for the price - definitely two servings worth. It was your average pad see you but I really enjoyed it. I would definitely come back! They also have free delivery, which is a nice perk.

I knocked off one star because it took us a while to have our order taken and for us to get our bill. Not something that would deter me from coming back but it seemed like there was only one waiter on a Sunday afternoon so it may have just been the weird timing.
author: Linda N.

description:
This was one of our better meals in San Fran - just simple, good comfort food. We were staying not too far from Tamarind Hall, and after hitting up a different cuisine each night (such is a luxury of a city like SF), we finally came to the Thai "leg" of our food adventure. 

We came in pretty late, half an hour before they closed; but they still served us, and never made us felt rushed - which we appreciated. We ordered chicken satay skewers and lemon grilled chicken fried rice. Both are not spicy and pretty boring choices, I know; but understand that we ate there during the freak heat wave at the beginning of September, and with hardly any a/c anywhere, I don't think we would have enjoyed a good hot curry that night, even if we had tried. 

We did, though, order the free lemon tea, courtesy of checking in to Yelp, so that was a nice bonus. Everything tasted very flavorful - I especially liked the skewers! The chicken fried rice, I found a little salty, but the chicken was pretty good (not dry or anything). For the record, my partner happily devoured everything with no complaints. 

Staff was friendly and food came pretty fast.

Overall, a good experience. In a city with so many choices, I'm honestly glad we made this one!
author: Amy B.

description:
There are few restaurants in SF where I feel immediately charmed and welcomed by the people working there. This is one of them! It certainly helps that their food is awesome : ) and the cozy space looks out into a cute historic street.

I had a lunch yesterday and was immediately greeted by the owner, Salisa, who gave me good recommendations and helped me choose a dish. I chose the pad see ew. I then read a book, all the while overhearing her share tourist tips to other tables of customers. It felt like a genuine neighborhood gem where the people running the eatery really loved their shop and wanted everyone to feel good with their meals.

The noodles were well spiced and al dente, a cut above other Thai places around North Beach / Downtown. But what really really really set this place apart was that I walked out of the place smiling and quietly rooting for them to succeed. This rarely happens with a grump like me.

Anyway, if you're in the neighborhood and want good Thai food and bar drinks in a genuinely hospitable hangout, please come here!
author: Ken H.

description: New favorite spot in North Beach! Lots of veggie GF options. Great customer service as well. Can't wait to come back! We had the veggie spring rolls, papaya salada and the jalapeño margarita. Both really good!
author: Judith V.

description: One of the best Thai food experiences I've had.  Great food from appetizers through main course.  The staff worked with the kids to make sure their portions weren't too spicy.  Clean and quiet. Highly recommend.
author: Jeff S.

description:
This place has some of the best food I have ever had in my life.   Appetizers were amazing.  The salmon was sushi grade fluffy, fresh meat and delicious. 
Besides a snaffu with delays in service/drinks/food with our waiter who was doing OTJ training, he was very friendly and courteous but a bit slow.  
We had amazing fried calamari, veggie egg rolls, roti curry with naan, and the hot chicken wings were THE BOMB .com 
The chef Salisa was SO gracious, professional and all about customer service and satisfaction. I left this place knowing her personally and happy for her and her family.  She's working hard core and is 8+months pregnant.  She was so friendly and talked to us about the food, service and process. It was so amazing to meet her.  We will definitely come back 
And they do catering too.
author: David C.

description: Food way too salty. The garlic noodles tasted like they were from the Mediterranean Sea it was so salty. I miss the 5$ anything on the menu from king of Thai. This was the worst Thai I've eaten in sf I've had in the last few months. King of Thai in union square still ranks as the worst lol
author: Fatty A.

description:
Cool music. 
Great service. 
Awesome thai tea.
Fantastic Kee Mao Pork. 
Try their special order, Omelette Pad Thai.
author: Youngree K.

description: Ordered an omelet wrapped pad Thai and it was delish! Service was great too I'd recommend this place.
author: Net T.

description: Delicious curry. Highly recommend one of the taster plates to try different curries, plus the naan is great.
author: Maya D.

description:
This place is an amazing find. My wife and I had the spring roles appetizer, green curry and pad thai. It was crazy good and for half the price you'll pay for a terrible meal at a dive off of Market or California street. 

I plan on going back and having everything on their menu.
author: Escondido C.

description:
I'm not going to lie, I wasn't blown away by the food here. When my gf and I went for lunch, the pad kee mao and grapraw klug kai dao we ordered were so salty we couldn't keep it down. I normally never send food back to the kitchen but this was definitely an exception for me.

The saving grace was the owner who apologised profusely and offered to change our order. Unfortunately by the time we got the food we weren't that hungry anymore and ended up doggy bagging the leftovers.

I really wish that I had liked the place. There's a Yelp promotion that gives you a free Thai iced tea with any entree and the owner is such a lovely person. Sadly it just didn't measure up to the Thai food that I am used to. 

Service is impeccable so perhaps I'll give it another try but I was definitely disappointed.
author: Eunah T.

description: Great food, great service, elegant atmosphere. The peanut sauce blew my mind! I love Thai food, and there were vegetarian options on the menu that I don't usually see, so I was excited about how many things I could order. My husband was also excited that the menu featured dishes with a wide variety of seafood we don't see often in the Midwest like Dungeness Crab. Great meal, and unlike a lot of restaurants we visited in San Francisco, no wait!
author: Danielle B.

description: Just okay, chicken and pork dishes were tough to chew. Confused why some of the veggies were prepared fresh and then a mix of frozen vegetables cooked in. I do have to say the jack o lantern curry was good. We didn't order a high dollar dish, so I can't tell if $20-30 plate is worth it or not.
author: Jonathan M.

description: The crispy rice with lettuce cups are great - but still there is something for everyone...lots of choices.   Love the food and attentive service  - would come back here in a heartbeat....
author: Ruthie N.

description:
I Loooove me sum Thai food. I can honestly say, 
I think this was the best Thai Food I've ever had!!. Stopped in here with a few of my buddies before a small venue concert. 

The Owner/Chef came out and expressed her genuine happiness that we enjoyed what she made for us. Her pride in her cooking showed through in her food!!

The food was fresh and the ingredients were top notch. The flavors all melded well & the different textures brought it all together to make the food amazing. 

The prices were reasonable and we had a cool spot right by the window. As we relaxed and enjoyed our food many other people began to filter in. With the excellent service, high quality ingredients & a top notch chef who took pride in her work this hidden gem is worth it!!
author: Nate D.

description: Looooove this place. Had a delish Drunken Noodle, fresh rolls, chicken laab. Will be my stop any time I have that craving for Thai.
author: Jason N.

description:
Stopped by here for dinner. great atmosphere. 
i got a thai iced tea for free when checking in and oh my god is it amazing! the best i've EVER had. 
ordered a drunken noodle and again the best i've ever had! the noodles are so perfectly cooked. very tender. they shimmer in all of the glorious sauce. the pork that i got with it was also cooked so well. very tender and not too chewy or soggy. 
comes with peppers which i personally don't like but i bit into just for the yelp and they were pretty good for peppers haha. 
the spice level is 4/5 but i have a high spice tolerance so it wasn't spicy to me. which is fine too. 
man this place is amazing i wish i could bring it back to texas with me
author: Kelly N.

description: Good but pricey... I get 1 order of pad Thai, add broccoli to go fairly regularly it comes out to $17.34.....  and I once got a side of peanut sauce, $4! It is pretty damn good though
author: James A.

description:
I have  been to this place last year with a friend who ordered a Thi ice tea for us , it was amazing from the beyond ! 
I'll for sure cost this place again
author: Mo'ad A.

description: This place is great. I frequently get take-out from here but the dining room is very nice. My favorite is the drunken noodles (Pad Kee Mao) or their pumpkin curry.
author: Bert J.

description:
This review is a little late in coming so forgive me!

Tamarind Hall not only has spectacular food but did you know that it's also a really great choice of venue for your event/party??

I'm here to tell you that it would be super for any small business or big family looking to simply get together or hold a party.

We held a retirement party here for our beloved COO on Dec 4 and the owner Salisa and her husband Todd made it truly an event worth remembering. I had to present a big video tribute and they met me the day before to do a sound and A/V check because we wanted it to be right. They have 2 fabulous flat screens in the main room, that play simultaneously and so the guests could watch from either side, depending on where they were sitting; so no one missed out on anything!

Contact them to inquire about holding your next big event-you won't be sorry!

Thank you to Salisa and the entire lovely staff for making the event so special.

Deb
author: Deb L.

description: I like the prik king, but the portion of the curries is really small. The ambiance of the restaurant is great though. The spicy chicken wings are really good too.
author: Hans H.

description:
This place by far has some of the best service I seen in any casual restaurant. The service is as if I were at a fine dining restaurant, without having to dish out $30 bucks for an entree. They are attentive, recommends new dishes for you to try and not afraid to have a little chit chat with you. You can tell they take customer satisfaction really serious because I overheard the manager one time making sure one of the waiter doesn't forget anything when he was serving the dishes. Plus can you believe it...? the manager was born in the 70s! She looks like she's in her late 20s. 

Now as for the food... this place has a pretty good variation of thai food and they even have dishes that are not commonly found in other places. They have thai sausages, fried duck eggs, carb curry with noodles.. etc. Each dish is plated beautifully and they make sure they show you how to properly enjoy your meal when they come serve it. I ordered the panang curry and it was good and just the way I wanted. Hint of peanut and hotly served over rice. 

TLDR; Overall, I highly recommend this place. Good food, menu has large variation, great service, and decent pricing. Plus, free thai tea with yelp check in.
author: Jenny N.

description: This place has great ambiance. Came here for lunch with my niece. We were warmly greeted by server and seated right away. Everything on the menu looked delicious and reasonably priced. We both decided to get curry dishes. I ordered the pumpkin curry which was medium spicy and my niece ordered curry the next level of spicy. I recommend if you like spicy, medium is not enough, but the flavor was wonderful. And, the coconut rice is like crack--I mean I wouldn't really know. But, I couldn't stop eating it. My niece's dish was the right amount of spicy. Portions are deceptively large so watch out. I wish we would have split something. We left with very inflated bellies. I would definitely go back, but not over eat the next time.
author: G F.

description:
Luv this spot! Former King of Thai / sports bar. Manager/owner name "Sa" is pretty and super nice. She had us try appetizer samples and follow up about the taste of their dishes. All of which were on point!

Seabass was mouthwatering served with garlic noodles. Roti with two different dipping sauce...yum! Roasted whole eggplant with spicy sauce and liquidy eggs: mmmm...mmmm good, my fav! Chicken drumstick with papaya salad. Minced pork with green beans fried eggs. Curry beef with rice. Mango with sticky rice and coconut sorbet!!! 
Buuup just thinking about the dinner. I want to try the mango mojito next time
author: Vee V.

description:
When I saw the name of this restaurant, I was instantly drawn because I love tamarind and the sourness it brings to recipes. While I didn't eat a dish here with tamarind, I found the food to be very flavorful. I came by for a weekday lunch and had:

--Yam Makua Yao: I've never had this before and I loved the tenderness of the eggplant and the salty, spicy, and sour flavors of this dish. The smoky bacon added another depth of flavor. The menu describes the eggs as soft cooked but our yolks were solid.

--Had Yai Chicken Wings: Battered and very crispy chicken wings that came with two delicious sauces, one chili sauce and the other more savory spicy.

--Crab Khanom Jeen: A beautiful dish. The curry was well balanced and did not overpower the chunks of crab.

The prices of the dishes were higher than I expected. Service was friendly and I'd love to come back in the evening for drinks.
author: Maya S.

description:
Amazing place for a nice dinner!

I came in with a 5-person group at around 9 PM after reserving online. It wasn't crowded at all during that time, so a reservation wasn't necessary. The decor is nice and the entire place has a very nice mood.

The servers were very nice and helpful. Patience is key with a big group! The food was fairly priced and of a good portion. I would definitely come back!
author: Christine K.

description:
The service was not so great but the food was delicious. Calamari. Omg yum!!!
Ask for the traditional Thai dishes if you don't find them on the menu. They will make them if you ask. Had Panang Curry. And Chicken Fried rice. VERY good.
author: Melissa H.

description:
I was excited to try the newly opened Tamarind Hall and see what this Thai food was all about. I couldn't remember for the life of me what used to be in this location but, there weren't any renovations with the new concept so the memories of a failed restaurant before plagued my mind. The space itself looks a little run down and weathered but, nevertheless I was excited to try the food.  

I started with some of the spring rolls and they were nicely crispy and hot. For my main, I ordered the Pad Se Yew with chicken and with a price tag of $11 it was well worth it. This dish definitely hits the spot if you're craving some casual Thai food. The portion wasn't terribly large but, everything came out piping hot and was satisfying. Other peeps dining with me ordered the fried chicken with rice and Pad Thai...they were both pretty good too. 

The service was a bit slow and all our dishes came out at different times (one by one) but, perhaps that's because they are still finding their rhythm in the kitchen. Tamarind is a good option if you're looking for something quick and casual. I'd think they are a better option for lunch.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Cheesecake and awesome stakes, what's not to like. The kind of place that makes you feel at home
author: Chris A.

description:
Our server was so sweet and helpful with recommendations. We had such a great experience. The place is nicely decorated and has a fun atmosphere.

The Had Yai Chicken Wings ($18 for 20 piece party platter) were AMAZING. That was probably the highlight of the meal for me. The garlicky marinade is so flavorful and addicting. We got the egg rolls ($9) and salt-n-pepa calamari ($11) which were pretty good but nothing memorable. I wasn't a fan of the Sai Ua + Namprik Noom ($15) which was pork sausage with sticky rice.

For the entree I got Khao Mun Gai ($14) which was poached chicken over ginger & garlic broth infused rice. I thought it was pretty plain compared to other times I've had the chicken and rice dish and wish I had ordered some of their other interesting dishes. The Knockout Snapper ($22) was really tasty and had great texture.

Overall I really enjoyed the food and would be back again!
author: Linda X.

description:
This place was amazing! We had a reservation at 7 pm on a Tuesday, which was definitely not needed since it was pretty empty. I'm guessing weekends are harder to get tables.

First of all, when I got there, I checked in and I got a free offer (free Thai iced tea). It was really good but kinda sweet (as expected).

For my main dish, I got the Pumpkin curry (veg & tofu) with brown rice and asked them to make it super spicy. It tasted really good! The vegetables were boiled nicely and the pumpkin was cooked perfectly. The curry itself was thick, but tasted great. It wasn't as spicy as I was hoping but I have a high tolerance. The brown rice was a great side; highly recommend switching the white for it (no extra charge to do so).

The meal wasn't that expensive either! Only $12 + tip and tax. I will definitely come back.

Side note: I love the TVs they have. If you're going with friends and wanna watch the game, you can see it pretty well at the dinner tables far from the bar!
author: Remy B.

description: I found this place on Yelp one late week day evening. The ambiance of the place is very pretty. The entrance is decorated with dried spices, tree branches decorated with LED lights and glass plant spheres. The servers are very nice and friendly. I ordered Drunken Noodles (Pha Kee Mao) with chicken. They have great portion with fresh ingredients. I asked for additional spices on the side. You will get three different spices, and the fried red pepper flakes & seasonings instantly enrich the flavor of the dish. It was so yummy that I had to take some in my to-go box :) Only reason I would give three star for this place is that the noodles of my dish was a bit over done. However, I would like to give it another shot another time. Also, you can get a free small Thai ice tea when you check in on Yelp.
author: Lisa O.

description: Nice little restaurant with good ambience. Food was very tasty we order deep fried Red snapper ($26) & drunken noodles ($13) , fish was cooked & fried perfectly with sweet & spicy sauce . Manager Lisa was so friendly & welcoming. This place is Highly recommended
author: Diha A.

description: Got some great service while watching the warriors game last night. Drunken Noodles were fantastic. HH Egg Rolls were good BUT you only get two decently small rolls for $6, not bad but I wanted more lol. Service was top notch, would come back for that alone. Free drinks if you make a reservation too, nice touch.
author: Connor H.

description: super sad to report that the second time wasnt nearly as good as the first! WAHHH! my gf and i came in last night for dins. we ordered - knockout wings, khao soy curry noodle (for me) and my gf had the green curry with roti add shrimp (complicated thai name).  the wings were definitely better, but my khao soy! the soup was SUPER thick, it was luke warm, the noodles were all bunched together!! SO SAD.  my gf really liked her entree though, so thats good. cocktails were all right. meeeeeps! disappointing still.
author: Christina L.

description:
We ate here after a flight to SF and battle with a rental car agency. We were tired, battered, and worn out. 

My girlfriend's cousin took us here and it was like heaven. We split the chicken curry and some chicken wings. They were both awesome. 

The staff was also very friendly and like most Thai restaurants, the food came out super fast. The prices were also pretty good.

I totally recommend this spot.
author: Michael B.

description: Stopped in today while wandering in North Beach looking for somewhere new to eat, and what an unexpected find! Incredibly kind and helpful staff. Super delicious food. My friend and I had a very yummy lunch.  I will absolutely return. Highly recommend!
author: Erin D.

description:
Just stop looking.  This is the place you want to eat.  I promise.   We found this on Yelp and we were in the mood for some Thai.  We were happy with everything we ordered.  We started with Chicken Satay, fried pork neck and Knock out wings.   All of them were great, but the knock out wings were outstanding in the group.   

For the main course we had beef drunken noodles, chicken panang curry and chicken pad Thai.   Zero disappointment.   Our group couldn't stop talking about how amazing everything was.  Were are planning a trip back to the city, just to come to dinner here.  

The best part of the meal was at the end when Chef  Salisa K. came out to ask how everything was.  She talked about her love of cooking and running a small business in San Francisco.   I love little interactions like that.  It really personalizes the experience and makes it special.  We will be back Salisa.  You are doing an excellent job.
author: Steve B.

description: Great Thai food, especially the papaya salad and pumpkin curry with brown rice.  The staff even treated us to free cocktails.  Great food and service.
author: Alfred C.

description:
Had a wonderful experience at Tamarind Hall. We made a reservation in advance (for four people), and when we arrived, they thanked us for making a reservation by offering a complimentary beverage! 

Our waitress explained that Tamarind Hall is particularly known for its curries, so we went with the "Curry-ous" appetizer (a sampling of all their curry sauces with a thin, pancake-like bread), which was delightful -- the green curry was really outstanding, as was the crab. The waitress was also kind enough to offer additional helpings of the bread so that we could enjoy all of the curry sauces.

Throughout the whole meal we had wonderful, attentive service, and the food was really top-notch -- not overly salty or greasy, with fresh ingredients (the "healthy fresh rolls" / salad rolls were awesome -- totally unlike the fresh rolls that I've encountered at other Thai places, with lots of salad greens, herbs, and chunks of fresh mango). Definitely recommend giving this place a try!
author: Sheila L.

description: Placed a lunch order at 12:06pm through Grubhub since no one at the restaurant was answering the phone. Estimated time of delivery 12:45-12:55. That kept getting delayed and delayed. The driver called to let me know he had been waiting at the restaurant for over 20 minutes and for some reason they were not getting the order done. The food finally arrived at 1:15 (15 minutes late for my 1pm meeting). Fortunately we were only 6 blocks from the restaurant otherwise if would have been even later. If you can't fulfill orders in a timely fashion seems like you're not ready to do delivery. The food was fine, nothing fantastic.
author: Alix L.

description: I don't remember what the restaurant that used to be here was called, but it was so much better than the current spot. The new place is too hip, overpriced, and the food is unnecessarily overdressed. That being said, the staff was very friendly and the place is cute overall. I'm not a fan of paying $18 for subpar Pad Thai, but if you're a gullible tourist that's wanting Thai in North Beach, this place is perfect!
author: joanna k.

description:
This is not the dive bar it used to be! (Although it's not *so* hard to imagine that it used to be one.) The new ownership has updated the interior to make it a chill neighborhood hang out spot. Super friendly service, good food, and a great cocktail menu I'd like to explore more. We had:

-Thai Me Up (includes rum and Tamarind syrup): Great combo of flavors!

-Screaming Thai Iced Tea: The adult version with Absolut, which was very subtle. Tasted like regular Thai Iced Tea (maybe that's a good thing?)

-Taro Fries: Delicious and addictive! Not at all greasy. Dip away in the sauce! Yum.

-Vegetarian Spring Rolls: Good, fresh, and conveniently cut into bite-site pieces to avoid the mess (and cooties if double-dipping isn't your thing).

-Pumpkin Curry (with vegetables and tofu): Great flavor, up there with the best I've had.

-Yellow Curry with Salmon: Unique combo that works well.
author: Cristina S.

description: I love it when they know their menus. Food is great and the service good. We ordered garlic , fresh spring rolls for starts and they were tasty.
author: Nouri C.

description: Food arrived late cold and in an unacceptable shape. See pictures!!! 25$ for nothing the driver who delivered couldn't care less. If you outsource your food delivery and cant guarantee that it arrives in top condition ...don't deliver !!!
author: Torsten P.

description:
Tamarind Hall is a fairly average place to grab a drink (I can't speak to their food at all).

Service is fairly prompt, they have interesting-sounding drinks with Thai influences, which certainly fits in with the theme.

The drinks themselves are pretty mediocre, though. There was a spiked Thai tea that was so cloyingly sweet, it was rather hard to choke down. I'm blanking on what my guy ordered, but it wasn't anything ground-breaking, needless to say.

If only I knew there were better bars just a few blocks away...
author: Claire S.

description: OMG (and I never say that) just ordered delivery from this place and man is it delish!!  Had the Tofu Salad, Pumpkin Curry and Vegetarian Fried Spring Rolls.  YOUZA!!  Incredibly good.  Can't wait to go there in person as the place sounds like a blast!  I'm a very picky Thai foodie and this is the best I've had in SF.  SO happy I discovered it.
author: Lynne P.

description: The best service and a very good food, we are going to be a customers for life, thank you Tamarind Hall.
author: Jose H.

description: This place is so great! Omg, the food is off the chain. Great favors, spices and the presentation was wonderful. It was my husband birthday and our best friends found this place and we order and share everything! It was great and allow us to try four different dishes and taste it all. We will return again.
author: DrBarbara S.

description: We settled in here for an early dinner just before 5 on a Tuesday. The place was empty and service was friendly and attentive. Started with the healthy Spring rolls which were good with the sauce, but would have been better if the avocado had been seasoned to give it more flavor throughout. Lots of delicious sounding & unique dishes to choose from. I had the Esaan duck salad and my partner had the drunken noodle. We loved both dishes and were stuffed.   I also had a Thai mango mojito since it was happy hour. I was looking forward to a fresh mango taste, but was sadly disappointed with what tasted mostly of rum. Fine for those that like their drinks strong, but I prefer mine more fruity. Overall a good experience and I would gladly go back.
author: Patricia H.

description: I was in with my coworkers for lunch. We got seated immediately. We each ordered a dish from the lunch menu. I got the classic Pad Thai with chicken. It was good and the portions was worth the price. Our server was super nice. Well definitely be back again to try the others out.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Wow. A fantastic authentic menu with the most friendly staff in town, who greet you with a welcome cocktail if you make a reservation. The eggplant salad with duck egg was a standout dish, but everything was flavorful, bright, and fresh. I can't wait to be back with more friends!
author: Mark S.

description:
Being born and raised in Bangkok makes me a little picky about Thai restaurants. Tamarind Hall did not disappoint! This was my 3rd time here at this lively establishment. My boy and I were celebrating his birthday at Tamarind Hall recenand we had a great time! They have nice selections of Champaign and fun cocktails. As for food, we tried:
Sai-Ua Namprik Noom: the sausage was flavorful and a lot of veggies on the plate. The presentation was very nice. 
Fish cakes: super fresh as they made them in-house.
Highly recommended if you're craving Thai food in San Francisco.
author: Pavin C.

description: Don't cone to North Beach often, but when we do this is probably the first choice for really good food.  This place is as authentic is Thai food gets.  Definitely recommend this place to eat before getting a lao dance!
author: Mike P.

description: My cousin and I are visiting from Los Angeles. One of the locals recommended this restaurant. Once we arrived no one acknowledged us, so we had a seat in what seemed to be a waiting area. Finally after a second waitress passed by I waved her over. The first waitress ended up being our server. Mindy really had this dry unwelcoming vibe. We decided to get up and leave. We felt like an inconvenience being there. Didn't even get to spend money to try their food. Good luck!
author: David R.

description: This place was delicious! My boyfriend and I got the very healthy roll and the 5 curry sampler with a side of rice. OMG the bread was amazing and I had to control myself to not order another side. Only one server which made service a bit slower but flavor won my taste buds over.
author: Crystal W.

description:
A friend of mine brought us to this restaurant on a sunny easter weekend after church for some delicious thai curry.

The environment was definitely chill and different from all the restaurant in North Beach and Chinatown. Maybe it's because our group are the only people there during that time.

I ordered the curry chicken noodle with extra noodle. Silly me was hungry, so I ordered extra noodle, and it soaked up all the delicious curry right off the bat. However, the curry was fantastic. It was thick, sweet, and flavorful. It has a creaminess to it. Very excellent. I just wish I did not ordered the extra noodle so my fat ass can enjoy a more consistent broth and noodle ratio. $16 for a dish that I can enjoy. 

I had no complain and would like to go back there again.

Oh, check in for a free Thai Ice tea.
author: Jian G.

description:
It's not often that I update my reviews months or even days later, but I feel compelled to do so for, Tamarind Hall. 

If you read my previous review you'll see that I made some pretty extravagant but honest allegations. I stand by those, but what I didn't address is the incredible care, concern and customer service that makes Tamarind Hall special. 

You see, I've posted hundreds of reviews and I'd say that a business owner actually takes the time to respond, (for good or bad) once in every fifty reviews or so. Usually with a brief, "Thanks for your review," but almost never with genuine concern to fix what went wrong. Well, Salisa K not only read, but listened and acted on customer feedback when she contacted me after my last review. She was professional, kind, intuitive and above all else, heartfelt. 

Customer service goes a million miles in the restaurant game these days and Salisa is better than 99% of the ownership that I come across. Serve me good food and I'll be a customer, but back that up with some top-notch ownership skills and I'll be a regular. You get it, Salisa/Tamarind Hall... you really get it!

That fifth and final star is right around the corner for me, I can feel it. Next time I'm in SF!
author: Brad B.

description:
Good food, great service,* free drugs.

Good food: I came here with around ten of the handsomest men I've ever had the pleasure of dining with, and we ordered a sizable portion of the menu. As such, I got a chance to try a little bit of everything. I enjoyed it all, from the soup (Tom Yum Goong) to my go-to Thai dishes (pad see you, pad kee mao) to the salads (Laab Moo) to the curries (Massaman) to the stuff I've never had and actually loved (Yum Kai Dao). 

Great service: Our server was a sweetheart, and she patiently and happily answered all of our questions, and brought us all the wine we ordered promptly (until they ran out of the ones we were drinking).

Free drugs: One of us turned around at one point, and just sitting on the back of his chair was an Altoids case stuffed with marijuana. I can't promise that this will happen to you if you dine at Tamarind Hall, but I think your chances are better if you bring a large group of handsome gentlemen. 
____________

*Although it was great overall, there was one issue where one of us didn't receive his main until about 25 minutes after everyone else, but no one really likes that guy anyway (hi Damien!).
author: Peter D.

description:
When my group showed up, some kindly San Franciscan paid it forward with a freshly rolled joint for the table. Talk about enhancing our eating experience and vibes man. 

Beyond the weed, this place had a great vibe and a decent array of Thai food and some nice wines, which they offer by the bottle. I went with the Salt-n-Pepa Calamari; this was a tad on the spicy side with jalapenos, light soy sauce, chili sauce, garlic, scallions, and ginger served with a sweet mint sauce. A superb way to start the meal especially if you're not familiar with Thai food. I'm not even really sure this is an authentic Thai dish. 

For the main, I ordered the Pad Woon Sen with stir-fried glass noodles, chicken, cage-free egg, and celery. It was a pretty flavorless dish and needed a decent amount of sauces and spice just to get it going. I tried some of my buddies meal, the Prik King with pork, served with homemade chili jam and flat noodles. Prik King, besides having a great name, was probably my favorite dish of the night. I loved the chili jam and the flat noodle combo, and the pork added some salt which elevated the entire meal.

Our group took up a good portion of the restaurant, and the seating felt pretty tight. The food, I wouldn't say it isn't good, It's just ok and being in San Franciso being just "ok" doesn't cut it.
author: Nate M.

description:
My experience at Tamarind Hall was mediocre, but I'll preface this review by saying that probably isn't a reflection of the average customer experience. I came with a large group of hungry dudes ready to "Thai one on" after a long day of work conferencing. 

Whoever had been sitting there before us left behind an Altoids container with a couple rolled joints. Seriously, it was just sitting there in plain view of guests and the servers. That, the loud atmosphere and the crowded group table we were seated at told me this was not the most upscale experience. 

But on to the food. I ordered the Prik King, both because I'm immature and wanted to say it aloud and because the combination of homemade prik king chili jam and spicy chicken sounded too good to pass up. It was tasty, but I've tasted far more flavorful dishes at many a Thai joint back home in Sacramento. The serving size also left a little to be desired. 

If there is any major criticism, it was the service. These guys were all over the place, sending different folks to the table, getting some orders wrong and bringing out dishes at different times. If I lived closer, I could see this as one of my go-to delivery spots.
author: Alex L.

description:
Delicious Thai food in a trendy setting, accessible late night on the weekends. Came in for a 10pm Saturday night dinner, checked in on Yelp for a free Thai iced tea and the place was packed quite late at night.

I had the Pad See Ew with chicken, while my dining partner enjoyed the green curry. The food was decent, service was very hospitable. The noodles and chicken were great, but the plate may have been left sitting out for a while as it wasn't piping hot as I like it. It wasn't a big deal and I didn't ask them to reheat it because it wasn't cold. Despite the minor hiccup, the food itself was flavorful and tasty.

Our waitress was super nice and when I asked for the check in offer, she brought a Thai Iced tea for my friend as well. Service was super hospitable and prices were super reasonable.
author: Alex L.

description:
My lovely coworkers took me out for lunch today. We got here before noon, the restaurant was empty and quiet. We got seated and our hostesses made some recommendations and went over the ingredients with us (dairy allergy). She was super sweet and friendly. 
The food was amazing! Fresh, beautifully presented and yummy. We had the eggplant salad, fresh rolls and a soup. I cannot wait to come back here for dinner.
author: Yelena K.

description:
True story...the diners before us left a rogue joint on the table by accident. I didn't smoke any of it, but the food was as good as if I had. Thai in Chicago can be hit or miss so when I come across a spot that satisfies like this did, it's worth noting. 

I did the Nam Prik Ong which is a traditional Chiang Mai specialty. Made with minced chicken, shrimp, roasted garlic, a boiled egg, shallots and tomato served with rice crackers, string beans, cucumbers, steamed pumpkin and sticky rice. If that description sounds like it was copy and pasted from their online menu, it's cause it absolutely was. Despite the lack of an original description I can say it was really delicious. 

The service was a little slow, but we had a group of 10 dudes so I'm sure that was a contributing factor. Overall, I'd say a 5 star delivery spot, and if you do dine in be sure to check in and redeem a free thai iced tea. Makes the experience more than worth it!
author: Danny W.

description: We have been to Tamarind hall couple of times. It's really nice place, good service and great food.
author: Ramandeep K.

description: By far this has been my favorite restaurant this week (visiting SF). Tamarind Hall is clean, the staff are warm and attentive and the food is amazing. I don't think I've had better curry anywhere! My husband was equally pleased with his order, saying the flavors were wonderful. We may make a second trip before we fly home!
author: Maren P.

description: This place was sooooooooo good!! Food was amazing prices reasonable great portions and AMAZING Devi e!!! It is a must must must!!!!
author: Jamie S.

description:
Very well decorated and thoughtful menu and drinks. It's definitely a more upscale restaurant and the food doesn't taste nearly as authentic and flavorful as so many other thai places in the city. 3 Stars because while it was a cute location the food didn't match up to the ambiance. 

Clean trendy atmosphere with average food but presented very well. Great service! The Basil Eggplant was plain but had plenty of fresh veggies and still tasty, while the Pad Kee Mao fell extremely short of the mark. I feel like they may water down the flavor since they service lots of tourists? Not sure why all of the bright Thai flavors were masked in both dishes. 

Wouldn't go back for food - maybe drinks and apps!
author: Samyutha R.

description: Ok food. We tried to order the burrito thing but they weren't serving it that day, so we turned to similarly priced items on the menu. I ordered the pumpkin curry, although supposedly spicy on the menu it was not at all and the rice was over cooked and smushed. My friend ordered the drunken noodles, thought it was ok. A lot of the chairs were wonky. Unsure how the higher priced items fare in quality, but for the standards I've had a lot better.
author: Max P.

description:
Check-in for free yummy ice Thai Tea! :))

I was craving Thai food and I finally got my Thai fixed :D. I got Pad Thai which was super duper yummy and aesthetically pleasing. 

P.S. It is also near two Poke Stops, so you can eat and play Pokemon Go
author: Judy M.

description: This place is just not that great! We went here only because the nearby restaurant that we actually wanted to go to had a long wait. This one only had 2 tables taken at the time. I got a chicken dish as the main and the chicken was unbearably dry. Other dishes we tried did not impress either. Skip this one.
author: Ivan S.

description:
Decent Thai food but overpriced if you ask me. I had the green curry and while it was delicious for $16 I was expecting more. I've had better curry for 10-12 in the city. 

Atmosphere is more on the hip side and a bit loud
author: Emily C.

description: Amazing and authentic Thai food. Hints of "street" Thai cuisine, with authentic flavors and ingredients locally sourced. If you're looking for Americanized, bland, run of the mill Thai food, sorry, this is not your place. Go to Osha Thai for that. I had home made "street sausages", Thai skewers with homemade Thai sauce, crab fried rice (real crab), pork neck with just the right amount of crispy fat, marinated beef salad, all cooked to perfection.  And the owner/hostess (Salisa) could not have been more personable and friendly. A gem of a place. I will be back...many more times.
author: Rick C.

description: Great thai food and great service! I really enjoyed the crab curry I got here as well as a chicken dish. :) The staff were super friendly as well and made sure we always had everything we needed. YUM, and will be back.
author: Caley Z.

description:
Great find! I came around 1 pm and the place was pretty empty. The food came out quickly and our waitress was really nice. The food was delicious! 

I am vegetarian and, at first glance, there aren't too many vegetarian options on the menu. But if you ask them to make something without the meats and with tofu and veggies, they will. It's hard to find a restaurant that will do that for you.
author: Halley N.

description:
We were feeling particularly lazy last night, so we decided to get dinner delivered by Tamarind Hall. My friend had recommended the place to us, so we decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised that it was an entirely different feel and menu from the thai restaurant that used to be in that location. We decided to try a variety of options (we were also hungry and couldn't make up our mind). 

What we ordered:
- fresh rolls with shrimp: tasty veggies, great peanut sauce, rolls kind of fell apart as soon as you picked them up
- crispy tofu: tofu had great texture, and once again came with a great sauce, but the tofu itself could have used some seasoning
- tom kha gai: my favorite item by far; generous portion of chicken and a clean, tasty broth
- pad kee mao with beef: fantastic noodles and a good helping of beef. Could have used a few more string beans
- basil eggplant with tofu: my second favorite item that we ordered. The eggplant was perfectly cooked (soft but not mushy), tofu had a ton of flavor, and it came with rice (what a great deal!)
-  side of sticky rice: because I love rice and eat it plain

The portions were on the smaller side, which is both a good and bad thing (good because then we don't eat too much, bad because there aren't any leftovers). Delivery was prompt and everything was packed up well. This will definitely be our go-to thai delivery place from now on, although I'm not sure I would make the effort to eat at the restaurant, as it looks pretty much like it used to (kinda rundown).
author: Regina L.

description:
Came here for dinner last night.  We got here right before the crowds rolled in at 7:45pm.  It was a  little noisy but intimidate enough that we weren't screaming across the table to chat with each other. 

We started with the spicy pork make your own wrap and the salmon ceviche.  The wraps were difficult to eat, the lettuce leaves were not large enough to really wrap and the teeny portion of rice was not really enough to fill the insides.  I didn't find the pork that appetizing.  The salmon ceviche was bomb though.  Seriously, order that!  

For the main courses we tried the crab noodles and the thai chicken.  The noodles were delicious.  Really light but full of flavor and a nice sized portion.  The chicken was somewhat small.  There were 5 of us and we were pretty full but the chicken was literally the size of a large drumstick.  

Overall, great spot if you are in the area and lots of great dessert spots to wander off to afterwards.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
First things I noticed about the place was the ambience: hip, chill, and welcoming. The music and decor were trendy, but not overwhelming. 

As for the food, although Tamarind Hall is listed as Thai, I beg to argue it's more of an Asian-fusion restaurant. They had a number of items that I would classify as Malay and Indian. This wasn't an issue for me, since I love all Asian cuisine. 

Whenever I'm eating Thai, I order curry-- it's my go-to dish. So, I decided to go with the Penang Curry with tofu and veggies. When the dish came out, I was surprised by the portion size-- it was huge! As for the flavors, the dish was anything but bland. Like your typical curry, this one was rich and creamy with coconut milk, pungent with basil, and spicy. 

A notable aspect of Tamarind Hall is their service-- our waitress was extremely attentive and friendly. Essentially, she made us feel welcomed, which I always appreciate whenever I eat out. I can't call Tamarind Hall an authentic Thai restaurant, but it's definitely a spot I see myself coming back to whenever I want to grab an Asian-inspired dinner with friends.
author: Nicole A.

description: Food was great. Tasty and everything seems made with very fresh ingredients! They have a good selection of vegetarian and vegan options. I especially enjoyed the very healthy rice paper rolls: it comes with 6 big pieces and the peanut sauce is delicious! Service was knowledgeable,  friendly and polite!!
author: Anna P.

description: Needed a place to take my boss and a few other coworkers for dinner during a conference. Picked this solely on the Yelp reviews and hoped for the best. AMAZING! Everyone in our party said it was one of the best Thai meals they had ever had. The "curry-osity" curry sampler appetizer is not to be missed. We had red curry, pumpkin curry and noodle entrees, all great. Seriously, if I get a promotion this year it might be due to this place.
author: Trista M.

description:
Don't come here for the food. It's not good at all - worse than even the mediocre Thai restaurants in the city. 

I got these and all were very underwhelming: 
Roti gaeng neur (beef coconut curry)
Duck noodle soup - probably the best of the group 
Beef jerky - dry, unflavorful 
North Thai sausage
author: Inga C.

description:
Pretty good.  I'm not sure about the pad see ewe.  It comes with a spicy side dipping sauce & not much brown sauce.  It's OK but it not quite pad see ewe.  Maybe call it something else?? Or maybe  being crazy and this isn't just the way it's served I their part of Thailand.  Hhmm...torn.  also had the Thai beef jerky.  It's was interesting.  Came with sticky rice and a very savory dipping sauce.  1st time Ielve welder had it. Definitely an experience.  The server is sweet and I have the place to myself on a Tuesday evening. 
The can is $11 compare to the $9 cab at Vesuvius, right around the corner.  And they're both good cab's.  
Thisn poo lace is a bit pricey for Thai.  The experience is decent though.   ;)
author: Sarena B.

description:
New place that took over King of Thai really knows what's up! They have some pretty unique dishes here that I've never seen elsewhere; the flavors are amazing, and the prices are reasonable! 

I really enjoyed the Gai Yang Som Tum (roasted chicken with papaya salad and sticky rice). The size of this dish was definitely substantial enough to be split between two people. The rice came perfectly roasted, with a sugary, charred glaze that was very aromatic and flavorful. The plates actually reminded me of  the Farmhouse Kitchen...I wonder if they're related? In any case, the sticky rice here is much better than Farmhouse. It was served in aluminum foil, which preserved the moistness of the rice, but it still had a nice sticky and chewy texture. The two sauces that came with the chicken were also really good (one was a spicy sour sauce, the other was a sweet and sour). I also liked that the papaya salad was sufficiently spicy, which is how it's supposed to be in Thailand. Great job chef!

The ambiance here is very casual with an almost sports bar vibe. It was pretty rowdy on a Monday night since the Warriors game just ended. The atmosphere was quite contrasting to the nicely plated Thai food, but somehow it worked.
author: Audrey L.

description: This is a hidden gem, we zeroed in on this after looking at other Thai options and so glad we did. We ordered vegetarian basil fried rice and drunken noodles with tofu; both the items were delicious. Service was good and quick. The ambience and decor is pretty.
author: Neha S.

description:
We wanted to check out some asian food during our stay in SF, and ended up here after reading the great reviews. The menu is extremely detailed and it took us forever to decide what to get, but we ended up sharing a tasting platter as a starter. That was the best part of our meal, everything was so fresh and delicious. 

Upon ordering our entrees I was a little anxious, because I struggle with spicy food. Pathetic, I know. But I noticed that the menu didn't indicate how spicy the dishes were, and so I asked our server about the one I was thinking about ordering (creamy noodle soup with veggies and tofu), and he assured me that is was very mild. It ended up being too spicy for me, and I took most of it home where I could add suitable amounts of dairy to balance it out. Everything was extremely fresh and well made, and perhaps thai food only can be made with a certain amount of spice, but if you as me have a low tolerance of spicy foods then be sure to mention it to the server (and perhaps stress it more than I did). 

Our server was very attentive and polite, and the restaurant was clean and with a nice, calm ambience. Overall a great experience!
author: Hilde T.

description:
The owner Celisa was super kind to us and gave us free Thai iced tea. 

The food was very authentic, delicious, and plentiful. Probably the best Khao Soi I've had since being in Thailand proper.
author: Kian L.

description: The food here was OKAY but customer service was terrible. I and my 3 friends were downright insulted by the lady running things here and she has the rudest attitude.
