We ordered the fried rice plate with crab meat/cluster, which we took to mean "meat mixed in with fried rice." No, it was literally fried rice WITH full crab legs and we were given no things to open them. We point out to the lady that the menu wasn't very clear about the crab legs and she responds by saying "it's in the menu. I'm not in the position to argue with you guys because I wrote the menu." Well, guess what, you have 4 licenses attorneys in your table who all understood the menu to not mean full crab legs so why are you getting so defensive? She then she cleans up the plates and drops a cup of soup on my friend and instead of saying "sorry" she says "oh, I was just tying to accommodate everybody!" She got defenseless and rude on our faces and there was no need for any of that. She did come out at the news and gave my friend $15 to get her clothes dry clean but AFTER throwing a tantrum at our table. What a disappointment.
author: Johanna C.

description: We made a reservation for 2 on yelp for Christmas night( yesterday)  @615 pm. We were running a little late (got there 622pm), so we called. First the guy couldn't understand me on the phone and i couldn't understand him either. We had a little language barrier and I was trying to explain to him, we were running late. He finally said it's okay, they will take care of us. When we finally got there, a lady tried to usher us out by saying there is a hour wait time for food. We told her we had reservation though so she sat us down l and now we are waiting. The layout needs some help for sure. I am not sure if they were short staffed or what but the waiter didn't take our order till after 7pm, forget about even bringing water to our table. Btw, he was taking orders of 2 other tables which had actually came after us!!! By this point, we are clearly irritated. So we now have put the order in, and we didn't  get out order till after 730pm! I mean, idk what was the point of the reservation. They clearly don't care for that. I'm only giving 2 ** because the food was actually good. If I had to order here, I would only be ordering take outs, given I had time to spare and will not go out of my way for this restaurant. I would recommend getting knockout wings if you love spicy food. It maybe categorized as a mediocre Thai place but not compared to OSHA, considering everything. We had to waive at waitress to get their attention to even pay. If you don't care for customer service and are okay with paying somewhat of an expensive bill, then this is the place for you.
author: Payal K.

description:
We stumbled across this place because we were exploring china town and found Tamarind Hall nearby on Yelp. It was pretty slow in there so I wasn't sure how good it was really going to be but I was very pleasantly surprised with how great everything was. The Thai mango mojito was SO delicious :) and the pad Thai and fried chicken over chicken fried rice were both great. I've eaten a lot of pad Thai in my day and the pad Thai here was actually pretty fantastic.
Prices are a little high at $11-13 avg a plate, but it is a pretty nice  bar/restaurant. Though When I came in it was pretty hot inside and it seemed like they really needed to run the ac or atleast some fans. 
The food was great though so I highly recommend :)
author: Becca D.

description:
Friendly service. The lady behind the bar was very sweet. 
Tom yum soup- on the sweeter side. There were minimal contents in the soup. Bummer. 

The steak salad was yummy. Meat was pretty tender
author: Tina H.

description: The drunken noodles were excellent. Green curry chicken spicy and delicious. Sever vice was wonderful. Full bar with tasty drinks and a big screen tv. Will definitely be back.
author: Maya K.

description:
Super super yummy. Walked over to the old King of Thai to only realize it's a completely new restaurant. The interior looks a bit different than before and decided to just go in and try. 

Ordered the kee mao kaw along with the pork skewers. Coworker ordered the crab fried rice. They were all delicious. Will definitely be back if am around the neighbor. The service was very friendly and also got to talk to the new owner a bit and learned a bit more about the restaurant. 

The menu obviously isn't as extended as king of Thai, but it taste a lot more healthier. Like it wasn't overly greasy or anything. Definitely get the pork skewers, those are really impressive even for someone who has visited Southeast Asia previously.
author: Alex C.

description: Tried the veggie curry sampler, Penang curry and drunken noodle. All pretty average. Not worth the hype!
author: Adwait A.

description:
The 3rd day in SF from Seattle, we kind of wanted to have Thai food and came here since this place has gotten high rating. 

We enjoyed every drink and food ordered. I could tell they use fresh ingredients. The seafoods in my dish was nicely soft and moist. The mango mojito was tasty too. 

The server lady Pam was pleasant to talk with. She told us the restaurant was just opened only 3 months ago. 

We are happy we found this restaurant. 

Keep up the great work!

We will be back when we revisited SF again.
author: Keiko S.

description: food is amazing and the owner is super sweet and greeted us as soon as we walked in.  the green curry was so yummy and the spicy wings are great!
author: Diandra L.

description: Good Thai food lunch option in North Beach. Food comes out fast and service is attentive. Their portions are very generous and my pad Thai had a lot of shrimp and tofu. I ended up packing half up for dinner. I will be back to try their roti and curry!
author: Linda H.

description:
It was good food, nice environment, and friendly service.
I was glad by stopping by here for a tasty Thai food.
author: Olga Y.

description:
Edit: I tried their delivery service this time and it took about 45 minutes to get to my apartment (I'm just down the street). It was better than pick-up because it just came when it was ready instead of me potentially standing around waiting for it. The food was good. 



It takes 60 minutes for a pick-up order to be ready on a Tuesday. Don't order takeout from here if you're hungry.

Edit: To clarify, I had ordered Pad Thai and a chicken curry dish with rice. Not a very complicated order.
author: Lindsey F.

description:
Wow! I wasn't expecting to find the best Thai food in San Francisco to be so reasonably priced - entrees were 10-14 dollars and were amazing and filling. I had a green curry with flank steak that was incredible and a papaya salad. I later found out that the curry spices are mixed fresh every morning and that the steak is marinated for a long time in a mixture of sauces to tenderize it. The curry sauce was the perfect consistency - not chalky like many other places in the city. 

If you like Thai food you should definitely check it out - if you go for dinner their bar is also great and has fantastic cocktails and scotches.
author: Roy R.

description:
Me and my friend were having dinner in North Beach and after walking around a bit decided to stop in for a night cap. The bar kind of had a weird vibe - great set up - super roomy - has a bar and a dining area. A few TVs with sports playing. We each ordered a drink and the bartender was attentive - I can't remember the name of the drink I ordered but it was basically a thai ice tea with vodka - and it actually tasted great! couldn't taste much of the vodka which is what I wanted - and it was delicious! My friend ordered the g-spot - it was much to strong for her but it was yummy and tart.

All in all - 4 stars cause it had a weird vibe, but drinks were reasonably priced considering SF!
author: Vivian P.

description:
We are visiting San Francisco and our friends suggested we come here for dinner..we weren't disappointed, it's the best Thai food ive had in a long time..and I just got back from Thailand!!! So, this review is totally legit!

Don't forget to have the Penang curry and the eggplant salad!!!
If you're into cocktails this place is amazingly innovative!!! Try the mango Mojito and if you feeling extra adventurous, have the birthday sex or g-spot..so naughty but oh so yummy!!

The staff members are so knowledgable and for my vegetarian friends..EAT HERE NOW!!!
Alright tamarind hall..till the next time we come back to San Francisco!!!
author: Rashmi M.

description: This place is AWESOME! I have been looking for a really good thai restaurant since coming to SF 1-1/2 years ago. After searching top 10 thai restaurants all with 4 stars I was not impressed at all. Then 4 weeks ago I was in Little Italy walking around and getting hungry and there on the corner was Tamarind Hill. Thai food in Little Italy? Hands down THE BEST Thai food I have ever eaten! Nice big clean cozy place. All their sauces and curries are made fresh every day. I just had my 6th meal there in 4 weeks. It is phenomenal!! If you are a Thai food fan you owe it to yourself to try this place. The owner is awesome. She takes orders serves talks with you. Cant say enough. Go go go!! You will find your thai food happy place.
author: David M.

description: I will never be returning here - the waiters literally avoided eye contact until I flagged them down just to be seated, our food took over an hour to arrive from when we ordered, and they ended up giving me the wrong entree. The staff seemed incredibly overworked, and the poor bartender/waitress had to constantly crouch under the bar to get between the bar and the restaurant(seriously, like at least 30 times during my 1.5 hours there). Really a shame because the food (even though it was the wrong thing) was pretty good and the interior was very well decorated.
author: L G.

description: If I can give 0 stars I would for this place.  Went there for a friend's birthday and it should be a sign of things going downhill when you ask the waiter what is special sauce and he didn't have an answer.   For a table of 10 people, they served 2 entries every 15 mins so only 2 people can eat while everyone watched on. The Pad see ew was cooked with pad Thai noodles and it was really small.  Ordered the Lao steak and it took 45 mins for them to make it. They asked how it want done but the steak was less than an inch so it was super done and then they lit it on fire so it didn't matter anyways. The steak was all fat and tendons and there was a piece of steel wool in it. The pad Thai omelette looked instagram ready but there was no favor. For 10 people, it took over 3 hours for food to be served and it was super hard to flag down any wait staff that night. Would not recommend going.
author: m c.

description: I stopped in this place on a day of playing tourist in the city for the day. What a gem. Polite staff, and the shrimp fresh rolls and Sea Bass entrees were out of this world. Put this place on your to do list if you're in the Chinatown north beach area.
author: Vinson G.

description: Went on a Sunday.   Was hardly busy but yet had slow service.   I'm giving it 4 stars based only on the excellent food (food is 5 star) - but not the customer service.     Service is a 2-3 star.    I waited almost my whole meal with an empty water before I finally yelled across the restaurant (which was almost empty) and asked for a refill.   So...in summary, food outstanding - service could be better.
author: John P.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Thai food so I was more than enthusiastic that my friends had pick Tamarind Hall for our triple date.

This was a bar/thai restaurant, which was really new to me. I'm more used to smaller Thai establishments that are more traditional and a little old school. The vibe was pretty hip here - as all things SF and I like it! You can go for night out with your friends and still get some pretty decent food.

My top favorites were:
1. The Knock Out Chicken Wings - SOOO GOOD, but if you can't handle spicy, heed my warning and do not order these. There is so much flavors in these, you can taste it even when your tongue is on FIYAH. 10/10 would order again.
2. Roti / Curry - the curry sauce that came with the roti is bomb.com which translates to bomb.com curry entree. Enjoyed it so much we ordered a second serving of the roti - nommy!
   *Although, we took the curry togo and the next day when I microwaved it, the consistency turned into a thick rubbery dough... Not really sure what happened there, but it did not look stomach friendly. Needless to say, we threw it away.
3. Salmon carpaccio - friends really enjoyed it, I thought it was a little on the salty side.

Things I wouldn't order again:
1. The two noodle dishes we got. Pad Thai and PadSeeEw, both were mediocre and not worth your carb calories for the day. Skip and try something else. These were disappointing.

I also got the Siamese .. something, I kept saying Siamese Twin to the waitress because that's all that would come to mind.. I know it's wrong but she knew what I was talking bout! It had St. Germaine and is a light fruity/sweet drink. Comes in a martini glass so you'll have to class up a bit and hold your pinkys out gentlemen.
author: Ngan T.

description: Amazing food! I came in a group of 15 people and the service was amazing. The manager/co-owners took care of all the orders and served us personally. The food here always tastes good. This is one of the best Thai place in the Bay Area.
author: Amit R.

description: Service was excellent and food was very delicious. It's in a very cool, trendy area. Can't remember what we ordered but it was about 6 different dishes and they were all amazing. Would definitely recommend.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Me and my husband were in SF for the weekend.On the night we arrived we were hungry and was looking for a place to eat.We stumbled upon Tamarind Hall after listing our names for another restaurant.So happy that we decided to eat here instead!We were greeted by such a friendly lady (not so sure if she was the owner or the manager) and she explained the menu and recommended what to order.

Our orders: 

1.Knockout Wings (Marinated Chicken Wings)
So flavourful and Yummy!Very strong flavors and spicy!

2.Sai Ua +Namprik Noom (Grilled Northern Thai Sausage)
This was amazing.And loved that we can wrap the sausage in lettuce or cucumber.

3. Yam Makua Yao
Such an interesting dish.The eggplant didn't taste like eggplant and the sauce with it had such an eccentric flavor.

4.Mango Mojito was just perfect to complete the meal!

All were fantastic and price for each dish was bellow 15$ and good for 2!
author: Bella T.

description: There was one large party in the restaurant and a few couples when we came in and it took a while for us to get seated and served. Most of the staff was running around like crazy serving this one large party. The fresh rolls and spicy eggplant were fantastic so we thought we were being set up to have a great meal. The pad Thai, pad see you and drunken noodles however were probably some of the worst Thai dishes I've ever tasted, and we eat Thai food a lot. The pad Thai was even listed to be a favorite but was awful! I would not recommend this place.
author: Roshni W.

description:
Will not dine here again. Slow service and below average food. Nice decoration but very disappointed in the food. 
Ordered roti curry (too oily), Pad Kee Mao (too oily), and Sen Lek Tom yam noodles (very plain). Check-in for free Thai ice tea (diluted). Every single item was lacking in flavor and salt. 

Prices range from $12-20 which is pricy for low quality food. There was only one server. We ordered our food when there was only one other customer, yet it took more than 20min for food to be served.
author: WQ C.

description:
WATCH OUT FOR HAIR IN YOUR FOOD

My family and I are regular customers of this place, the food is usually good but today customer service was terrible and I found a hair at the bottom of my food (Basil Eggplant). 
I ordered food to take out and I was told it was gonna be a 15-20 minute wait so I came back and I don't think they had even started on my order. When I got back to the restaurant and asked about my order and my ticket had been forgotten. They told me and my brother that it was gonna be a longer wait. The servers were pretty rude the would just tell me and my brother to move with no tact or customer service skills whatsoever. The only person who was courteous was the bartender. 
I was being rushed out as I was trying to check if my order was correct. 
I noticed that they weren't treating everyone the same way. 
I learned that they have little regard for hairnets, health codes and they're not customer service oriented toward latinos.
author: Diana C.

description: Two times here. Solid Thai food and service. Best Thai food I've had in SF. friendly staff. Khap Kuhn khap
author: J K.

description:
Fabulous!

The food was delish and the service was the kindest we have ever had. We were there 5 min before happy hour ended unbeknownst to us and they still made sure to get us the menu so we could get in an order. We had the egg rolls and the crispy tofu. We also ordered the salmon curry off the main menu and a Thai milk shake. We will definitely go back often!
author: Scott C.

description: Great service first of all and good food and drinks. I got the roast chicken with green papaya salad and sticky rice. It was a big platter of yummy! Chicken was flavorful and the green papaya salad was good for me but too spicy for my friend. I should of just asked for more salad and no rice. I didn't eat the rice, low carb for me. Well then I ruined it with the delicious shaken not stirred "Thai ice tea shake" the froth was tasty, ask Taylor to make it for you.
author: Karen T.

description:
Wow. Tried Tamarind Hall since we were craving authentic Asian and the wait for Chubby Noodle was an hour...this Thai place was INCREDIBLE. Delicious, authentic, & soul comforting food.

For drinks we tried the Screaming Thai teas which were delicious. We had the fresh rolls which were perfect and the Duck Salad where the duck was cooked and seasoned to perfection. 

I ordered the Panang Curry and my mind was BLOWN. I've never tried a Curry dish before and I do like Thai/Asian flavors but this dish was perfection and I have been dreaming of it since. I spent the week dining out and this hidden gem was by far my favorite.

Everything we ordered was amazing. Highly recommended.
author: Megan P.

description: Some friends and I are in SF for my birthday weekend and we decided to come here last minute. Great choice ! The food is delicious and there's a great selection . We tried the Thai tea and it was also a thumbs up. The bartender was super nice ! Good service and great food overall . Will be back .
author: Alex A.

description:
Best meal we have eaten in San Francisco!
Yam Makua Yao (eggplant)
Phuket style crab meat khanom keen 
Pumpkin curry
Morning glory ( not on menu, just ask - Real Thai street comfort food)
All amazingly well prepared and tasty. 
Can't say enough about great food and service.
author: Hank H.

description:
I visited San Francisco a week and a half ago walking, enjoying North Beach and checking out the street Italian party atmosphere on Sunday, when Columbus parade was going on. Without having any desire to eat Italian food, as every place was packed, my girlfriend and I discovered this fantastic, hidden Thai food gem.

The service was absolutely fantastic and the food magnificent. We had vegetarian egg rolls, chicken satay and Yum Kai Dao. Everything had amazing flavors, wonderful presentation and lots of love.

I will be back there the next time I am in San Francisco as this was the best Thai food I had.
author: Sylvia G.

description: Great great great bartender! Will definitely be back soon!!! Extra detail to presentation and communications. Love this place
author: Donna H.

description: Food was excellent! The steak was delicious and eggplant salad was flavorful. The staff and service were friendly, courteous and professional. We met the owner who was warm and friendly. A great overall experience!
author: John D.

description:
AVOID - had this food last night for the first time and I literally ate and run - to the bathroom that is - stomach was upset for a good 5 hours 

Ate the chicken which I think was a signature dish - signature all right - will def remember this place for a long time 

If you're looking for Thai this ain't it -
author: Phillip S.

description:
Husband and I came here late Friday night. We sorted restaurants by what was open, and Thai sounded good, so we ended up here. Service was okay... Not unpleasant but not particularly friendly or attentive. We felt a bit rushed and weren't really checked on besides when we got what we ordered. The waitress did let us know when last call for food was though! Which was nice because that didn't anyways happen. Friday night the kitchen seemed to close around 12, but I don't remember the exact time. The full menu was available until then. 

Food was satisfying... Better green curry than usual places. Comes with an egg, noodles, and veggies. Good quality ingredients. Curry was pretty brothy/thin, styles wise. What I liked was the chicken wasn't that semi-mushy/chewy chicken pieces that are cheap quality. You get a lot of food with this dish! It was very good; I'd get it again. I got a side of jasmine rice with it, which I think I preferred to the noodles. It was her particularly aromatic of anything, but the noodles were a bit mushy for my taste. 

The appetizer, chicken satay, was pretty good. Came out luke warm which was kind of weird because it wasn't busy at all. 5 small skewers of chicken with a flavorful peanut sauce and some cucumber bits. I was expecting bigger pieces for $11 but it wasn't too offensive. Husband got the Prik King with chicken. He said he expected it to be spicier but said it was pretty good. Satisfying but now like, wow-ing. He ordered a side of the peanut sauce for it which seemed to help for him. 

Thai tea was pretty good but possibly too sweet for some. I almost asked for more tea for it, but it wasn't quite enough for me to bother. 

The dining space is small/medium, but it's not too crammed, and not loud despite a bar and sports on TVs. 

I enjoyed my curry more than husband liked his Prik King, but I'd go back. =)
author: Kat B.

description: The panang curry absolutely knocked it out of the park- just the right amount of spicy, and perfect zing of fresh ingredients.  Best I've tasted in a long time.
author: Knute R.

description:
Everything we ordered was delicious. The panang curry was really good.

Edit: I have been here a couple additional times and still really like it. The papaya salad is really good!
author: Jordan J.

description:
Great food friendly service!
Went here last week with some family members and a co worker who are all really into Thai food. And we all loved it. I had the crab meat curry myself which tasted great like everything else. The staff was attentive and sincerely helpful and we had a great time. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes Thai food. And come on who does not like Thai food. :)
author: Chris W.

description:
Delicious! Best curry I can remember. 

Wife got the Massaman curry and I had the Roti Gaeng Neur. Both were excellent but the Roti was the order of the night. Roti was flaky and crispy, and the Gaeng Neur curry was superlative-- spicy, sweet, and rich. This is a must-order!


Good prices too for SF-- less than $15 for each entree!
author: Larson T.

description: Honestly not bad food considering what you usually get in San Francisco.  If you come here, don't expect the best Thai food, but if you're around the area it's not too bad.  Service was top notch and extremely friendly.
author: William L.

description: Fresh rolls were very good. They have at least one explicitly vegan dish on the menu, but it came out a little cold. Drunken noodles were amazing. The spice numbers on the menu are no joke - I had to take a quarter of it home. Drinks were excellent. Will definitely be returning.
author: Paul S.

description: I've been here twice and loved it both times. Most recently, we made a full meal out of all the delicious appetizers upon the suggestion of the owner. She is so sweet! Make sure to have the egg salad and the special of the day. They also have some items that are fresh from the market and they specially incorporate them into the menu (I'm not sure if this is on a weekly/bi-weekly basis or what-just ask). Can't wait to go back!
author: Soumya G.

description: So-so Thai food. Slightly westernized and upscaled. You know something is off when the waiter and menu refer to the Tom Yum not by name but only by "hot and sour" soup.
author: Norcloud S.

description:
One of the underrated Thai restaurants in a city that has too many mediocre Thai restaurants.

I used to live relatively close to TH and would always bring friends to this place - everyone loved it! The hosts are Thai, chefs seemed Thai, and everyone was courteous and helpful when  suggesting dishes for the first time or tenth time there. I especially like the appetizers like fish cakes (usually made fresh) and another highlight would be the chicken rice (khao mun gai). My friends have gotten the curries and loved it too. 

Overall, this place takes the time to cook and present authentic Thai food at very reasonable prices and is definitely worth a visit if you're looking for cocktails too!
author: Kevin K.

description: Very friendly staff with great recommendations. I was going for Penang curry but was expertly talked into a noodle bowl that was 100% BETTER!
author: Russ F.

description:
I was looking for a Thai place around the northbeach/Chinatown/SOMA area and stumbled across this place after finding out king of Thai was no longer there. We came in and got seated immediately on Friday night around 730. We must have just beat the dinner crowd because it soon got crowded. We were seated, told the specials, and served by the manager. How rare is it that the manager is working the front and interacting with customers to provide great customer service? We ordered:
-Yum Kai dao (3.5/5) this upscaled egg dish was beautiful and kicking with flavor. Little pricey but prices I was expecting from being in this area.
-Shrimp Pad Thai (4/5) pretty much what I should expect from a good Thai place.
-Khao Soy Gai (4.5/5) was what I was dying to try upon researching this place. The broth was flavorful with a good amount of heat and not overwhelmingly thick and creamy. Would definitely come back for this dish. 

Overall a good priced dinner in the north beach with amazing customer service. Check in for your free Thai iced tea that's worth it!
author: Katy C.

description:
So freaking tasty! It's like a better version of what used to be here. Their laab was really good, the beer towers were great the eggplant was delicious... 

I'm super happy to have a place that's this yummy, still very approachable prices, and yet still this cool to be at. 

I'll definitely be back, and with friends!
author: Preston P.

description:
We live in the neighborhood and were so impressed with this spot. They've grow into their space and created a great ambiance and warm, friendly staff. The food I s phenomenal. I first had a seafood platter that was amazing, but our forever favorite has become the curry noodle soup. 
We used to come to King of Thai when it was still located in the same spot. We originally avoided Tamarind Hall because they had higher prices. Holy Crap what a mistake. This place is phenomenal- we have yet to find a dish that isn't anything short of incredible and worth the extra spend. It's on a whole different level.
author: Megan C.

description:
This is my new favorite Thai restaurant in the Bay Area.  Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious.

The salmon ceviche was a great way to start.  It's more sashimi than ceviche, but super fresh and covered with fresh chopped onions and herbs.

The grilled eggplant was succulent and light, but full of flavor.  It is dressed with herbs and a sprinkling of bacon. 

The taro fried were fluffy.  I couldn't figure out how they did it.  (Maybe mashed and then coated in taro powder?) On the one hand, they're still just taro fries.  On the other hand, they're the best taro fries I've had.

The salmon curry was also great: really vibrant curry flavor without being too heavy.  The staff mentioned they grind the curry spices every morning.

The pineapple and coconut sorbettos were a perfect way to end the meal.  They weren't too sweet and were light enough to refresh without bogging you down.

The presentation of each dish was also beautiful.  A few of them also came with orchid garnishes, and the sorbettos were served in the frozen shells of the fruits themselves.

I am going back and bringing friends.

These guys need to start a second location or sell their food at stores.  The only bad part of the experience is that parking around the restaurant is tough.
author: David L.

description: I went there after reading great review and I ordered vegan fried rice. Instead of vegan rice, they served rice with egg. At first i was sceptical but thought it May be tofu but At first bite I realised the taste is quite different than tofu. When I asked the chef about whether it is an egg, she changed my dish without telling sorry or explaining or confirming that there is an egg. I am not sure what will happen if someone is allergic to certain food.
author: Mahaveer J.

description:
Tamarind Hall was awesome! The staff were really helpful with recommendations and service was great and quick! 

We ordered some cocktails and were surprised by how sweet they were - until we realized they were for the heat coming up! They were perfect for the hot spicy and delicious food to come. 

We got a roti and curry, which was served with both green and red curry for dipping, and this was awesome. Some of the best we've had. Then we got the grilled eggplant appetizer which was really tasty, it was a very unique flavor and had an interesting tangy sauce with it. 

For mains we got the khao soi, which was incredible. We've been chasing the dream of khao soi ever since visiting chiang mai 3 years ago, and these guys delivered. It was sweet, spicy, soupy and crispy all at the same time - yum! We also got a pad kee mao, which was okay not great, it just paled in comparison to the delicious khao soi. 

I will definitely be back here to try out more delicious northern thai foods.
author: Deepak R.

description:
Amazing food, delicious drinks, and great service!  Salisa, the co-owner, is so welcoming!  Loved everything I ate there and will definitely be going regularly :) 

(Try the Roti Gaeng Neur, it's delicious )
author: Lauren C.

description:
I went here for the first time and my experience was pleasant. I was seated promptly and the waitress was very attentive and took care of us! The wall decors are really interesting too! 

Although the food was great! I got satay chicken and a curry entree which I substituted tofu in place of protein. The food was great, but the curry dish wasn't the best I have had. I wish I could remember the name. But the peanut sauce didn't pair well with potato and other vegetables used in it. 

Anyways, this is a nice location with great service and decent menu items! Recommend!
author: Tanzina A.

description:
Tamarind Hall is a refreshing, authentic approach to Thai food, incorporating elements of both traditional Thai cooking and adventurous street food. The owners and staff are Thai, and the Thai hospitality and culture shine through the entire experience. I have been twice, and have relied primarily on recommendations of our servers to pick out favorites. Even when we went with a group with pretty diverse tastes (a few hungry boys and a vegetarian), they picked a nice variety of choices for us all to share, explained what everything was and took care to tell us what was spicy and what had meat. We ended up with great food that came out in a nice cadence (not all dropped on the table at once) with something for everyone. Also the space is completely renovated from the old King of Thai and it looks fantastic with very cool art. Definitely a whole new experience and new ownership. 

On the menu, favorites are Laap Gai (which my boyfriend tries to make at home now we loved it so much) and the Roti Gaeng Neur (both with beef and tofu), which was warm and spicy. I'm not normally a big fan of curry but this was stellar. The Somtum Gai Yang was another favorite on the lighter side - spicy and very fresh. The eggplant salad was a vegetarian special that's definitely worth trying too - it uses the eggplant as a base for a bunch of seasonings and flavors that really shine. Can't wait to go back and try more!
author: Alexandra M.

description: I love their Classic Pad Thai !!! Awesome place to bring your friends to have a drink and watch the games or to bring a nice girl for dinner !!!
author: Levi V.

description: This was terribly disappointing.  We took friends from out of town there and the service was dreadful.  It took them AGES to get our drink order, the place was not even full, and then WHEN the food finally arrived, it was extremely mediocre, bordered on greasy.  TERRIBLE service, except when we went to pay the bill.  They certainly kept checking in on us for us to put our card down.  That was the most attentive they were.  And bordered on rude and highly lacking in customer service.  Good thing for them their restaurant isn't any bigger.  Keep walking, don't stop here.
author: Laura W.

description:
Great place to stop at if you're in Chinatown and crave some Thai food. I went on a Friday night and it was jam packed! I got a table right away which was right by the door. Normally I don't like being able to feel the cold air gust in every time the door is opened but it was so warm in the restaurant I actually looked forward to anyone opening the front door! I think they should maybe turn on the AC when they are packed, all the body heat really makes it uncomfortable to sit there through a meal.
Now for the food, I ordered their vegetable pad Thai and Panang curry. The pad Thai was decent, the noodles were a little thinner than I'm used to but the flavor was still there. Their Panang curry was delicious though! It was very flavorful and they include a side of rice with the dish.
The best thing about this restaurant is definitely their screaming Thai ice tea! It has a splash of vodka in it and tasted DELICIOUS! I would have never thought of making Thai tea an alcoholic beverage but it really goes well together. 
The reason for four stars is because the service was a bit slow. I understand they were busy on the night I visited but I feel like the waiters could have checked up on our table a little more often. I had to stop a lady and ask her for the check. Other than that, they have good food and their signature screaming Thai tea was amazing!
author: Darien C.

description:
Food for last nite I  I'm shocked that this place has4.5 stars !? We order the chicken wings well it's okay me and my friend order the soy curry and duck noodle soup. the curry soup there's no curry!It's terrible noodle it's dry broth it's not fresh couldn't even eat another spoon! 

 AVOID!!!!!!Do not waste you money on this place!
author: ANngel L.

description:
I had the pleasure of stopping by from NYC with a group of friends during July 4th weekend and we were treated to some great authentic Thai food (been to Thailand several times), tasty drinks and amazing service by Salisa and her staff! 

It's a casual setting with a separate bar area. There are several TVs for checking out the game if you'd like and some cool art of nak muay (Muay Thai fighters) on the wall. 

Grilled Eggplant - Hard to explain, but it was perfect flavor and texture.I love eggplant and this is one of the best renditions I've had with an interesting mix of ingredients. Def. have to try if you like eggplant! Curry Noodle Soup - very creamy broth with great aroma and flavor. Chicken leg was cooked and seasoned just right as well.  Steak Lao - Great cut of steak in a marinade that complemented it perfectly. Medium rare was on target. 

I had a good number of drinks as well that were mixed by the bar. They don't skimp on the alcohol, but they aren't too strong either.

I highly recommend grabbing a bite here or checking out the bar. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in SF!
author: Jason W.

description: Two thumbs up!! Bartender Bew was beautiful, nice and outgoing!! Did not ignore us and our did not take that long. Food was delicious! If I did not live so far I would come here 3 times a week. Great job Bew and stay beautifies!
author: Amado Adam L.

description:
My fiance and I were initially apprehensive about coming here, as we used to frequent the place when it was King of Thai Noodle. We definitely missed the old, grungy, sports bar-esque decor the old place had, as it's been replaced with a particular kind of "up-scale" look.

However, we forgot about all of that once the food arrived. The appetizers and entrees are even more amazing than the old ones! Everything was beyond fresh and seasoned so well, that simple dishes were complex in flavor and texture. The fried chicken was cooked perfectly that it tasted sweet, savory, and melted in our mouths. We did, however, miss the usual duck on the menu, but got our fix with a delicious appetizer that had some. Our cocktail was fabulous as well!!

We'll definitely be back, however not as often, as we mostly came here after closing up shop in the area after 11pm, which is when TH now closes. I would definitely recommend this place to all looking for amazing Thai food in the area! It's certainly my new favorite Thai food spot.
author: Jessica L.

description: This spot was perfect. We were hungry and had walked awhile.  Kids had spring rolls, sweet rice.  I had Panang so did my wife.  Very reasonable prices, good for kids, full bar.  Craft beers.  I recommend
author: Cris H.

description:
This place is the nuts. I discovered it 3 weeks ago and have since been well over 10 times. Don't be that lame white person who orders pad thai. Instead get the Khao Soi. It's an incredible dish, and this specifically is the best Khao Soi I've had in the US. A little spicy but you will be rewarded for your courage.

They have a vegetarian Khao Soi option too which I might like more than the chicken version. I order veg : chicken in a 60 : 40 ratio. In general this place is very friendly to the veggie life.

Everything else I've tried has also been high yield, except the duck soup which was just okay. It's probably good compared to most duck soups, just tasted bland when compared side-by-side with the Khao Soi and other elite spicy dishes

This place has a very positive energy as well. Great for watching sporting events as there are TVs you can see from almost any seat. The cocktails are creative and I enjoyed the beer choices as well

Again, the Khao Soi is so legit. In fact, I've set many of my online avatars to an image of the Khao Soi from here. Recently I've started opening conversations on Tinder by asking if they've heard of Khao Soi. It immediately builds rapport even though they usually say "no what are you talking about"

10/10
author: Christian D.

description: Best selection of appetizers of any Thai restaurant in the area. Try the Thai Salmon Ceviche (Fresh salmon salad), Nam Dtok Nuer ( medium-rare beef salad) and Yam Makua Yao, is a fried egg plant with, bacon and duck eggs, just to name a few. Great place for dinner and a fun place for happy hour.
author: Philip N.

description: Took our office here for a birthday celebration. We were warmly welcomed from the moment we stepped foot in the door! We were served delicious Thai Iced Teas after we checked in on Yelp (perk), had a great lunch, and they brought out a birthday ice cream duo after. We'll definitely be returning!
author: Natasha M.

description:
Both food and service were great. Being Thai I'm always slightly skeptical when trying new Thai spots, but I have to say Tamarind Hall is good and I'm glad it's so close!

We called in an order for take-out and arrived to pick it up at the agreed time, however the delivery guy had accidentally taken our order. The owner was extremely accommodating, had our dishes made immediately, and gave us the entire order for free. Not only were we impressed by the service, but the food was really good. We ordered 5 dishes and each person liked what they got: tofu drunken noodles (pad kee mow), chicken wings, chicken green curry, and shrimp tom yum. I got the tom yum and it was one of my favorites in the city - not too salty, fairly spicy, and perfect level of sour. They also did not skimp on the shrimp!

And the prices are fair. I won't say cheap because nothing in SF is cheap, but it's cheap-ish for SF dinner prices (~$10-$14 per dish) plus good portions, taste, and service. This will definitely be a regular dinner spot!
author: Maleenee B.

description:
Loved the food - strong flavors, very fresh ingredients and cooked to perfection. Lots of unique options on the menu. 

Service was phenomenal - everyone is super sweet and nice to talk to and very helpful! 

Ambiance is just right - good seating area not too crowded
author: Bhavna K.

description:
We got a pretty short notice reservation at Tamarind for an anniversary dinner. The food was delicious and came quickly. My wife and I both commented that we didn't realize we were so hungry, as our large portions disappeared from our plates quite quickly. 

The staff was very busy with a pretty full restaurant, but were attentive to us and flexible with our high energy toddler. Speaking of our toddler, the restaurant had a high chair with fully operational straps - parents will know tgecstruggle of finding a fully operational high chair in some restaurants.

All in all, we had great food, enjoyed dancing in our seats to the electronic music that was playing, and had an excellent anniversary dinner.
author: Paul K.

description:
What an amazing place!  Had a couple of beers and felt so welcomed! We met the owner and she was great! Definitely coming back to see Selisa. Great staff great beer. Very classy.
If you are ever in the area stop by, you wont regret it. I rarely write reviews but had to for this place. The food was delicious!!
author: Frank S.

description: Food is excellent, great use of spices and aromatics. The service however, was lacking. The waiter never came to check on us, our water glasses ran empty, empty serving plates sat on the table because the waiter never looked over to see how we were doing. We kept trying to flag the waiter for a couple more paper napkins, but wasn't able to get his attention. Surprising, as the restaurant was not that full on a weeknight. Still, this is a great place to go if you want great Thai food that goes beyond the pad thai served at most Americanized Thai places.
author: Kit F.

description: This place is has very tasty dishes, very different from the old place. It seems like more Thai home cooking:))I give it a good/excellent rating for the place:))
author: Sherwin W.

description: We arrived at around 2 for a late lunch. My husband and I shared the three curries with naan bread, chicken satay, and salmon with garlic noodle. All three were great and we all probably come back. However, we are looking for the spicy chicken that Racha restaurant used to serve. Haven't found anything to match that yet. The host was very gracious and welcoming.
author: Rowdy L.

description:
Group of 4 of us came and ordered 3 small plates and 3 entrees plus dessert. The bill was a little over 100 and that included 2 drinks! For value alone I would recommend this thai place. 

The stand outs were the Yum Kai Dao appetizer and the gai yang som tum roasted chicken. The Thai Iced Tea was very sweet but our waitress gave me extra cream to add as needed. 

Fun place to catch up with friends. The physical plates are too large though and we had to rearrange our entire table to fit all the food we ordered.
author: Meredith M.

description: This is some of the best food I've ever had in my life! The workers here were so genuinely welcoming and kind I've never experienced anything like it. I tried the curry-licious and the each curry was brilliant. Definitely recommend.
author: Ancheta P.

description: This is a great restaurant, really authentic Thai food that is served in big portions and delicious. I got the drunken noodles which were amazing. There's a fun bar to also watch the game, it's your new neighbor spot, delicious and tasty food!!
author: Karena C.

description: Would definitely go back.  I found the meal to be a good value (portion size X quality) to be great.
author: Dennis W.

description: Good food good crowed excellent service will be coming back for emergency dinners. I got tom yum soup and chicken rice highly recommended
author: James D.

description:
Food was OK. Service not so good. We were party of 9 and we ordered apps and entrees and none of the food came out at the appropriate times. Meaning 1 person would get an appetizer then 15 mins later next person got appetizer then 10 mins later entree rolls out.

I like that they use real Thai chillies.
author: Rajesh G.

description: Based on numerous online reviews we went to Grant Ave to visit another location, but arrived and the other location was crowded, too small and not welcoming to new guests - So we walked up a few doors to Tamarind Hall.  We are so glad we did!  They were so welcoming and friendly.  Best of all, everything we tried here was based on their recommendations and everything was great!  We sat at the bar given there was only two of us. This super helpful bartender 'Mindy' helped us pick and try the best things on the menu. Starting with drinks, they had a nice variety of beer, wines, and adults beverages - all of which were very good.  For appetizers, Mindy suggested trying the 'Curry-Osity' as a curry sampler and home made Thai Bread - soo soooo good.  Great start and recommendation.  Then for our entrees, we ordered Phuket-styled Crab Meat Khanom Jeen and Salmon Yellow Curry.   Ok - just to note - NEITHER OF US HAVE EVER HAD CURRY!.   These entrees were incredible and a great intro to Curry.  Mindy shared that the Phuket style Jeen was not something easy to get in the states and was very good - So right, as it was so good. Great blend of noodles, flavor, and crab flavor.  Mindy also mixed it for me to show how to properly eat it.  So great! The Salmon Curry was also very good and perfect for a intro into the curry world. Service was so good and friendly.  We observed many families stopping in, locals, and other visitors.  The environment is modern, new, but casual and definitely not stuffy.  Great evening ambience.  This is definitely a place I will return to visit.   We gave it 5 stars, given their quality, taste, price, environment, and just overall friendliness of Mindy and the staff.  One of our best nights in California.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Service is always so good here but the food is lack luster. I've been here a hand full of times and really wanted to like it. Wait times for food is kinda long if its busy as well. Seems like they are under staffed. 

Hope they work on their reciepes.
author: Linda W.

description: The flaming ribeye was great. Service was good as well. Walked in with reservations at 6pm, the place was empty but filled up quickly. Ok prices for a place like this in the city, but better food can be had for less money.
author: Art C.

description: Stopped in to have a beer. Great atmosphere.  New owners. Super friendly environment. Definitely would come back in. Awsome beer prices too . Wings are delicious. They have 4 TVs in the bar to catch the game.
author: Lawrence C.

description:
When King of Thai closed its doors, it was kind of a sad occasion. I had yet to try Tamarind Hall and now I'm regretting it. The yelp pictures looked great, food looked fresh. The person taking my order on the phone was friendly, and so was the driver. 

Pad Thai - no flavor, noodles kinda stale
Pad Kee Mow - way over done noodles, even more bland
Basil Eggplant - it was okay, but there was no basil flavor
Tom Yum Goong - Spicy water is the best way to describe it. 

I liked everything but the food. (note this was based on me walking by and ordering take out)
author: Steven C.

description:
I've been to Tamarind Hall for lunch several times now and have been consistently impressed. Both times tried different curries. The flavor is rich, there is plenty of meat in it, and the complimentary cucumber salad is a great starter. They include rice for free with curry, and allow you to substitute fresh vegetables at no charge.

More importantly though was the service. One of the most annoying things that could happen going out to eat is getting to the end of an entree and still feeling hungry. Now, the portions at Tamarind are actually quite good so this has never been a problem. However, today at the end of our meal, our waitress came over and asked "Are you full... would you like me to get you any more vegetables?" That just blew my mind. Every restaurant should do that. It makes the customer feel so good and it costs them so little. A small gesture, but now I will definitely back and recommend it. Well done.
author: Greg S.

description: I went here with my boyfriend because of a friend's suggestion and couldn't be more disappointed. He got Pad See Yu and I got Pad Thai. We tried to bare with it and eat the food because we were paying for it. But, couldn't even eat more than a few bites because we thought it was so gross. It tasted like straight fish sauce. Don't get me wrong, we are okay with paying for food made for us, but we weren't even offered another option after we politely told the waitress we didn't like the food. I definitely will never be going back.
author: Christina M.

description:
Came here during lunch, ordered their Crab Fried Rice and I cannot believe they use imitation crab (you know imitation crab is just fish paste right?). First time I've seen it used in a Crab Fried Rice. For a $12 dish this is ridiculous. But the fried rice was actually tasty, I would have been ok if it's an $8 dish.

I went with a group of 9 and for 3 of us the orders came very late, one person actually needed to pack it to-go. They apologized by giving us a discount.
author: Peggy M.

description:
First impression. Walked in for a to-go order of wings. Loud music, feels like a late night club/restaurant. 

Wings were fried and tasteless, literally no seasoning, just a vinegar side sauce that I used to drench them for some flavor.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Came here hungry at 10:30 at night. The service was pretty slow and then the food came out so fast it worried me if it was microwaved. 
I got pad see you and it was decent but meat was chewy. My friend got the pad Thai and it was fine. My friend got the mango cocktail and it was too strong and tastes nothing like mango. Would not come here again if nothing else was open.
author: Malina M.

description: Spectacular food that tasted amazing, very friendly and helpful staff. Great all round experience
author: Jarrod W.

description: Yumm jack-o-lantern curry and Thai iced tea with almost generous portions, fresh flavors and great service
author: Tulsi D.

description:
Nope.... There is no flavor in any of their food whatsoever, also the Worst Tom Kha I have ever tasted couldn't even eat another spoon of it.

Do not waste your precious money on this fake thai food place.
author: Makenzie A.

description:
Order from the street food menu. Everything was so flavorful and bold! The sai ua knocked my socks off! Drinks are super strong and very affordable. 

On the subject of strong drinks, everyone was wasted off their rockers here on a Saturday night at 10:00pm. I was forced to watch a 'bro' strip tease onto his table and then scurry off into the night with his shirt unbuttoned to the top, flailing like a cape behind him. So if you're not into that kind of stuff, come earlier lol
author: Katie O.

description: I'm a bit of a yellow curry connoisseur, so I can usually judge a Thai place by their rendition of the dish, how well the rice that goes with it is done, etc.  Tamarind Hall blew me away.  Their yellow curry had the most unique but authentic flavor I've ever experienced.  It hit all the perfect points: not too spicy, not too oily, not too thick or too thin: just right.  In fact, I swear I could taste each seasoning as it melted in my mouth - a good sign of fresh ingredients.  A nice bonus as well: their rice was cooked absolutely perfectly.  In fact, I don't ever think I've had rice cooked that well.  The spring rolls and sauce were crisp and flavorful, to boot.  Nice rich atmosphere and fantastic service - I'm definitely coming back soon!
author: Brad F.

description: We decided to visit this place during our trip to SAN Francisco and now I can say it's one of the best Thai restaurants! Everything is just delicious! Good prices also ! Highly recommended!
author: Katya K.

description: Came here for my birthday and the best choice Ive ever made. Ask for Salisa. She made my night and is the best host you can ask for. Food and customer service is superb and this is the epitome of amazing customer service. Definitely coming back for more.
author: Ino C.

description: Delicious and Authentic!  Try some of the non-regular thai dishes.  They make some that you do not see at every place so worthwhile to be adventurous. Nam Prik Ong, E-Saan Sausage and Grawpaw Kai Dao.
author: Scott e.

description: We had chicken Pad Thai, chicken Curry and fresh spring rolls. Got a free iced Thai tea  (thanks yelp!).  Pad Thai was ok, a little different taste than I am accustomed to, but no biggie. The chicken Curry was heavenly, creamy and light. The spring rolls were the highlight, as they were very hearty and fresh.  Would come back!
author: Leslie H.

description: Pad See You (Beef) and Sticky Rice is bomb, bomb. Went to get take out and was given a free Screaming Thai Iced Tea. Food is great, great location, great service.
author: Jonathan C.

description: This is my new go-to spot for Thai cuisine in San Fran--and frankly, is the best Thai food I've had in the United States. Each dish has its own flare and flavor profile that pleasantly deviates from what's served at some of the mainstream restaurants like Osha. The salmon ceviche, grilled chilean sea bass, prime rib-eye...you really can't go wrong with anything on this well-priced menu.
author: Swannie M.

description: Good food, good drinks, and some of the friendliest staff I've seen. The waitress for our table was very friendly and conversational, and the jazz music was really fantastic as well. Had a great time
author: Hunter B.

description: I love two blocks away and have only ordered food to go with eat 24. The food is okay. I've had the eggplant, pumpkin curry (twice) Tom yum (vegetarian) soup bowl, and a few other things. If it says it's spicy, and you order it mild it will still be verrry spicy. I can handle a moderate amount of heat, but the mild is almost to spicy for me. They also drown it in sauce. I'm a saucy girl, I can never have to much. But when your curry is literally a soup, that's going overboard. Luckily I always get take out and can leave half the sauce in the container so I don't drown my rice. It's always a bit too salty for me. Only reason I ever go back is because it's only two blocks from my house and they have some vegan friendly options. Would not recommend unless as a last resort.
author: Abigail L.

description: Had an incredible meal at Tamarind Hall with a large group of friends.  I had a delicious vodka based coconut cocktail and enjoyed some incredible Had Yai chicken wings.  We also had an amazing salmon crudo appetizer and i fell in love with their green curry dish called Roti Gaeng Neur. Authentic Thai flavors with a modern menu.  They had warm wood decor in the bar and cool murals in the dining room.  A nice step up from your average Thai restaurant, it was nice enough to bring my parents. Service was friendly and attentive. Will be back for sure.
author: Jordan C.

description: I love the food here and my mother was in from out of town so I decided to take her there. Again the food was not the problem. I had my 2, 4 year olds my 8 year old, mother husband and myself. I ordered the 20 priece chicken wings for my 3 children split. They did not come out till myself and other adults were almost finished with our food(I was even feeding my kids off my plate till it came, not an issue I will always my children first) but they could have told me it would be that long. Then when I got my bill they added a 26.78 gratuity for a party of 6!  How do you even justify making all the kids wait till everyone else was finished to bring their food, and then count 3 entrees as a party of 6. Ridiculous I really feel like I was just scammed out of 30$ for my kids to not eat and just take up 3 extra chairs. I will also add the restaraunt was completely dead it was after lunch rush and only 2 other people in. So for 1 appetizer 3 entrees and 2 sodas the bill was 187.34 the whole 26.78 gratuity was almost double any entree cost on the menu. Not cool or ok and will never go back because of desperate need of 30$ to allow children to take up 3 chairs in an empty restaraunt and not even get their food .
author: Eleyana H.

description: Fish was completely stripped to the bone and doused with overly sweet sauce, with very little meat, and it cost 25$. I had to go home and eat something again because I was still hungry. Extremely slow service, was waiting over an hour for this food.
author: Jay P.

description: Great service, tasty food and a terrific location. The bar tender was awesome and took good care of our large party and the over ambiance of the restaurant was fun, energetic. I'd come back for sure!
author: Dave S.

description: Great place to hang out with friends and family...excellent food and friendly service.  The owner Salisa is the most professional business person I have seen in a long time.  Super attentive and really cares about her customers.  We celebrated my friends birthday and Salisa made it extra special for us.  The presentations of each dish is beautiful.  Food is unique and delicious.
author: LC C.

description: Love this place. From the fair prices to the excellent food, to the amazing customer service. I'm hesitant to share my SF gen with y'all but it's a can't miss locale. :)
author: Kevin W.

description: First couple times I ordered delivery the food was good (4 stars). One of those times the order was severally delayed (1.5 hours), because they sent my food to the wrong address. The quality of my most recent delivery order was simply okay. Pad thai with seafood was mainly squid (didn't want that really), the pumpkin curry didn't have many vegetables, and the egg rolls were primarily wrap and not much in the way of ingredents. This was a lesser experience than before.
author: Brian H.

description:
Excellent value for the price especially considering this is San Francisco!  We found the environment to be comfortable and less chaotic than many restaurants - we were there for an early dinner and we could actually hear one another talk for once.  The service was excellent.

We enjoyed the Tom Kha Gai and Tom Yung Goong soups - both were flavorful and stocked with high quality ingredients.  I would expect the Tom Kha Gai to have more mushrooms than chicken but it was in fact reversed :)  We also loved the fresh roles.  We ordered and shared the Panang curry - and that was decent - lovely portion size - not the  best panang I've had but very good.

We recommend and will return!
author: Denise K.

description: This is a great little spot to grab some delicious and trendy Thia food. The waitress spoke Thai and the cocktails and food were great! Plus the neighborhood is trendy and the atmosphere is relaxed but upscale.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Very Nice, attentive staff and cool vibe. (there is no more upstairs, the space is smaller and the environment was lively)

They have 3 TV's - all three tuned into the Warrior Game (TV's could be better for a "sports bar") and they were playing good music. 

I walked in and ordered 'to go' - I was recommended the Gai Yang With Som Tum (house special marinated chicken breast served with papaya salad and sticky rice). The 'to-go' presentation was off, portions of the sticky rice were uncooked and very hard to break up and incorporate into my meal (impossible to eat with a fork alone, had to use my hands). Papaya salad was good, inconsistently spicy.

Unfortunately Tamarind Hall doesn't have any dishes that pop's off the menu. Seems like a traditional Thai menu, and I'd love for there to be some smaller creative dishes that would be good to share with friends when watching a game. 

I will come back in hopes of adding another star to this review.
author: Stephen L.

description: Meh. I liked king of Thai more. Same food but cheaper. This place is trying to be all fancy and nice but it isn't there. I think it's ok Thai food for the area if you are craving Thai but not sure we will be back. Took forever to get seated, sat by the kitchen door, and had pretty shitty service.
author: Taylor P.

description: Tamarind Hall is amazing. The food was excellent and the people were friendly. I live nearby and will definitely come her a lot.
author: Kevin R.

description: Thai cuisine is my favorite food in the world and Tamarind Hall is my favorite spot for Thai food in San Francisco. The waiters and bartenders are super friendly, the cocktails are creative and refreshing, and the food is flavorful and authentic. If you're looking for amazing flavors and a fun time, look no further!
author: Peter M.

description: If you want amazing Thai food, look no further! Took a trip to San Fran and stayed in Fisherman's Wharf. All the food around there is terrible, so I'm glad I found this gem down the street. Decided to order family style; we had the wings (cannot go without having these), spring rolls, chicken pad Thai and crab meat fried rice. For dessert, we were skeptical about trying the sticky rice with mango, but let me just say, I kept thinking about that dessert for the rest of my trip! 10/10 overall
author: V L.

description: This restaurants food and service is over and beyond! Their menu is creatively designed with a natural and authentic touch. The servers and the owner are all wonderful people who want nothing but good food and good relationships! Definitely going back!
author: Grace C.

description: Always wanted to give this place a try so UberEATS  delivered the food. pad see eww, steak Lao and papaya salad came Cold and bland So shocked to see this place got 4 stars so disappointed.
author: Jenn G.

description: My wife and in-laws and I had a great experience at Tamarind Hall tonight. The owner, Cerisa, was incredibly attentive and hospitable. My wife has a few food allergies and Cerisa was so accommodating. The service was great and the food was delicious. Would highly recommend to locals.
author: Aaron G.

description: Delicious wings. Truly unparalleled.  The right balance between sweet and salty, spicy and tangy.
author: Nicolas D.

description: Amazingggggg food love it full of flavor and amazingggg service they recently open and I am sure they will do great I will definitely be back
author: Ghenwa S.

description: This place is amazing! Every single dish is delicious. Great food, great price, great place , and great staff!
author: Sara M.

description: All of the food was great, but I must say that the Yam Makua Yao was literally the BEST eggplant I have EVER had in my life! I have no idea how they made it so good. And the service was awesome as well! Salisa the owner personally came by many times and was so nice and helpful.
author: Harold S.

description: I'm shocked that this place has 4.5 stars. Are their reviews fake? I've never had worse service at a restaurant in SF. After one hour of waiting and having to flag down the staff to even get water, I walked out because we discovered that the waiter didn't even take my order!
author: Selen A.

description:
Excellent hosts with some really exotic food.. A great place with exemplary service and food that is very authentic ... Please keep up the engagement and food quality..

Friendly staff and authentic Thai Food the staff and Manager are passionate of the people and the food they serve..

Please continue the Panache and Taste
author: Siby J.

description: We sat at the bar to drink and eat. They have unique, amazing food with great customer service. The Mgr/co. owner and bartender were helpful picking out our dishes. I will definitely come back when I'm in town again.
author: Tina H.

description: A real find in North Beach. High quality food, generous portions ( the serving plates themselves could be a bit smaller though) nice wait staff in a fairly spacious setting. We came in around 8 and were seated easily. The menu is not huge but plenty to satisfy wants. They have bat in the back and  a good list of bar bites noodles  and salads ,which for some would be enough. A selection of soups and  tasty mains. We got 5 dishes for 4 people Basil Eggplant ,massaman curry ( this could have been a little tangier), roasted chicken leg with multiple spices, The standout for me was  Roti Gaeng Neur -Prime rib eye steak in  curry, coconut milk, thai eggplant and basil leaves served with crispy roti flat bread.Of course pad thai, did not feel the peanuts as much but the flavor was all there. We were told their new chef is from Lers Ros , which might explain the consistent high level of preparation. 3 areas I'd improve 1) is noise reduction, it gets excruciatingly loud  either from their (annoying blase)  music or other diners. It's a real problem. 2) The decor has no sense of style or character, they could easily fix that. Lastly, the plates for serving are huge and the small plates for eating are like coffee saucers, which makes for a very awkward situation trying to eat with 4 people at a table. Go for the food, and hope it's not too crowded or you wont hear your self think.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
Love the food, music, drinks. Always fun and inviting. Definitely one of my new favorite places to go! The calamari is excellent, all the food is served quickly and you can tell immediately how fresh all the ingredients are. The place is a big hit in my book. Thanks!

Ordered food for delivery, arrived faster than promised, super hot and fresh. This place continues to impress me.  Well done!!!
author: Kevin K.

description: We have been here twice now, both times food is great and service is excellent.  Owner Salisa is very kind, prompt and attentive.  All of the food seems well prepared and as authentic Thai as we have had in this area. Good bar specials too. Located in North Beach, hope they stay around for a long time.  The Dessert tray was fantastic!
author: Bentley L.

description: Really want to like this place.  Pretty food but lack in flavor and service is inconsistent - good when it's not busy but terrible when it's packed. Like the drinks at the bar but probably won't eat here again.
author: Cindy W.

description: Awesome food, extra ordinary customer service and ambience. Must visit place when in SFO.
author: Apurva V.

description: Ordered delivery, got the pumpkin curry, some noodle style soup - both were excellent!  Sausage appetizer was not amazing, but I'll definitely try this place again.
author: Thomas R.

description: Love this place! Delish food, fun & friendly staff, and tasty beverages :) The Had Yai Chicken Wings are a must. So are the Fresh Rolls (super fresh).
author: sundeep a.

description: Ordered the tom yung goong and the pad kraprow Kai Dao mu (pork).   Excellent food, tastes like home made.   Cocktails are very interesting as well, very nice southeast Asian versions of old standards.
author: William B.

description: So glad this place opened down the street! Great for delivery and kept the same prices as King of Thai. The drinks are delicious and Salisa the manager is the best!
author: Jackie C.

description: I went here for lunch today.  Tamarind hall was truly excellent.  Decor is quite trendy, and everything feels nice and new.  The service was quite attentive.  I got an appetizer - The yam Makua Yao (eggplant.)  the eggplant was spicy and full of flavor, yet cooked to the perfect amount of firmness.  The massaman curry was also great.  It was creamy and was full of flavor, which worked well with the chicken and potatoes and onions contained in the curry.  I didn't have a cocktail but the liquor selection was extensive.  Overall it was a stellar dining experience and I highly recommend tamarind hall.
author: Jeff M.

description: We walked off Columbus looking for a vibrant, quaint restaurant and couldn't have been happier with this find. Not sure if the food or the service was better. We highly recommend this place if you are in the mood for Thai!
author: Bill P.

description:
Real good authentic Thai food that is not afraid to show off the true flavors of Thailand. I'm so glad to finally find a place that is not 'Americanized' in its flavors and menu. 

Service was efficient and manager was super friendly & helpful. Cocktails - delicious. Highly recommended!
author: Yu N.

description: We were visiting SF and looking for a place that closed late. We were happy to find Tamarind Hall is open late and even at that time the food is pretty good. I don't like my food spicy so I ordered my pad see iew at a zero spice level and it had flavor while not being spicy. My friend ordered panang curry and it was delicious as was the mango with sticky rice. The staff was very kind and friendly even offering to take our picture because our selfies were failing. We probably had three or four people checking on us so it was nice to see the staff so attentive. Great place for a late dinner. The ambiance is chill and there's even a bar to just watch a game at. We had fun and I would probably go again. Parking was hard to find tho so we went to a parking structure and walked in our high heels for a bit. I'd say it was worth the walk.
author: Nia D.

description: Visited tonight with my family. 5 different dishes, all absolutely delicious. Very highly recommend this place. If you like Thai food and you're in San Fran, stop here..
author: Fabien P.

description: Passed my Thai litmus test,  yum woon Sen was outstanding. Tod mon was also very good. Portions are generous and the service was warm and personable.
author: Benjamin D.

description:
So glad this place is finally open... First impression: real good. I love the new home style vibe. It's a little classed up from what it was before (though the brews are still cheap for when I'm buying a round... Or getting a round bought for me ;) ). Place is equally good for grabbing a bite or watching the game (Im doing both).

I had the khao soy and some egg rolls. The egg rolls were good but the khao soy was slammin. The noodles are so good and the curry, coconutty sauce really hit the spot with a bit of spice to spare. 

I also tried a couple of the cocktails which are fun. FMD sour is my jam, no question.... though you might catch me sippin' a mango mojito if no girls are lookin, haha - but for real.

....Oooooo they just dimmed the lights. Now it's vibin'...

Anyway I'm into it. I'll definitely come back and hopefully I'll bring a babe (keep the mojito thing between us tho).
author: Erich S.

description: This place is awesome. We had a holiday dinner here recently and were very impressed by the food, service, drinks, and atmosphere. The food was all very flavorful, with just the right amount of spice, and well presented. The chicken curry was outstanding. Service was also great. We had a largish group and the staff was very accommodating to all our requests. Drinks were also the jam. Definitely check this place out.
author: Ameen S.

description:
This Thai restaurant is so so good! Everything we had was amazing - some of the stand out dishes were the eggplant salad, the larb and the Khao soy curry noodles. I've been to Thailand 3
times and the flavors instantly transported me back there! The cocktails are also delicious - I had the SF to Bangkok and the FMD Sour, both yum. The ambiance is great - nice decor, good music that is not good loud so you can still have a conversation. Great place for a meal or just to catch a game!
author: jenni l.

description: I ordered a pumpkin curry and it came with only one 1/2" chuck of pumpkin.  The wings we paid $11 for didn't even come with the order.   And needless to say, the order arrived late (took more than 75 minutes) even thought Yelp 24 said it would arrive between 45-60 minutes after the order was placed.
author: Shirl L.

description: Here's to a little gem right here in North Beach. A unique menu compared to other Thai places but certainly a good ambiance.
author: Deepak S.

description: Service was good but the food left me questioning my health. The fresh rolls had brown lettuce, the chicken tasted really off, the papaya salad was so salty it was inedible. Probably a good place to drink but not for food.
author: Christine O.

description: Was staying in Chinatown alone and was craving some Thai curry soup. This place was hip, had great music, and there drink menu looked filled with everything you could want. Not to mention the food was authentic and outstanding. I highly recommend this to anyone in need of curbing their Thai craving in SF
author: Zach T.

description: Amazing place. Had the salmon lemon curry and tom kha soup. The flavors are unreal. Can't recommend it enough if you are looking for a great, affordable spot to eat in north beach.
author: Taylor G.

description: very nice food from north thailand.. Crab Khanom Jeen was very well balanced without overpowering the crab. Open later in the night.. perfect for late but good grub! Will be back.. Also cheap beers..
author: N K.

description: Pretty good food. Had the vegan Pumpkin curry and enjoyed it.
author: Madelyn T.

description: Stumbled across this place a couple weeks ago. Super friendly, attentive service, and the food was fantastic. It's near my office so I'll definitely be making this a regular lunchtime spot.
author: Jess Z.

description: The food here was so delicious.  Everything we ordered was fantastic.  The staff was very accommodating.  It was a little cramped at our table, but that probably just meant we ordered too much food!
author: Sandy F.

description: The Pad See Ew was mediocre, and our server was relatively inattentive despite the restaurant being not terribly full. It took us asking twice to receive glasses of water. The ice glass for the can of Diet Coke had a hair in it and was not replaced when we asked for another glass. Since there are so many other Thai places, I don't see a need to try this place again. Not recommended.
author: Max V.

description: Thai (fusion) in a trendy, gastropub-esque atmosphere. Of our 5 person party, most of us did not enjoy the food. It strays from what makes Thai food great (right spices, simple ingredients) and instead aims for a unique spin on things which falls flat. Furthermore; my girlfriend and I got mild food poisoning afterwards. Our guess is from the undercooked chicken satay. The service was mediocre. There are much better options in SF for Thai food, this place will not be on the go-to list anytime soon.
author: Andrew F.

description: The pad Thai is arguably one of the best I've ever had. Loved my coconut too. The other dish we ordered was fine - the pad Thai alone would've made this place a 5. Nice accessible location, nice service.
author: Christina R.

description:
I saw the high reviews for this place and decided to order for a company lunch through doordash.  

Let me start with the good:
The Pad See Ew

Now the bad:
1.Tiny portions.  I mean really tiny. As in one dish consisting solely of 2 tablespoons of shredded pork with some cabbage leaves tiny.  The curries were very watery and plain, but the kicker is that they use tiny containers and filled them up half-way.  I can understand a restaurant having to portion their dishes to save money, but this place takes it to a new level.

2.Food was mediocre.  It wasnt exactly bad but definitely not good.  It was also on the cold side, but I suppose doordash is responsible for that.

3.They forgot to bring 2 dishes with the order.  It was only an 8 item order so 25% missing is very very bad.  It took over an hour to get the missing dishes, by which time we didn't need them anymore.

A word to the business:
I know you guys just opened up shop, but this is definitely NOT the way to grow your business and gain more customers.  You lost a whole lot of customers today.
author: Andrew L.

description: Ordered delivery. Hot and fast! Delicious pumpkin curry, basil eggplant and crispy roti! Would definitely order again!
author: Jennifer R.

description: Great Thai food. VERY, VERY similar to true street Thai food. But cleaner restaurant feel. Lol:) GREAT food GREAT service. Must try if in the area.
author: Harout J.

description:
Came here for a holiday get-together, and so glad I discovered it! All the dishes we had were amazing, definitely a good place to do family-style so you can explore everything the menu has to offer!

The service was great and I loved the drinks. We got a pitcher for the group that made for a fun evening :)
author: Steven S.

description: Came to just pick up quick bite to go. Met the owner. What a nice lady. Excellent food too. I'll definitely be back!
author: Cedricke D.

description: Came here for a birthday party.  The food was outstanding.  They have all the common Thai dishes, but also some other interesting ones I hadn't had before.  I especially liked the cocktails and the service was great.  The atmosphere is fun and modern and it's right in the heart of North Beach.  Overall, Tamarind Hall is fantastic place to start a night out.
author: Andrew F.

description: One of the best Pumpkin Curry dishes I've had. And I forgot to ask for it mild so took a chance. But had just the right amount of manageable heat and tremendous flavor...all in a cute, little swanky atmosphere with a bar that I will definitely revisit during night time get-togethers.
author: Deb L.

description: Great food, fun ambiance! Try the pad tai and the pumpkin curry. Oh and the fresh rolls. Top notch cocktails not to be missed. We will be back.
author: lulu d.

description: I used to go to the old Thai place here but Tamarind Hall's new makeover is a great addition to the neighborhood. Their food is fresh and authentic (I spent my childhood in Thailand) with a fun twist on cocktails. The staff are attentive and friendly. The back area has kind of a sports bar vibe to it but all I care about is the food and will definitely come back for more!
author: Rachel W.

description: We had their wings, and the flavors were amazing! Good atmosphere, good service, great food. We weren't looking for anything specifically and stumbled upon this place and it exceeded our expectations
author: Brad H.

description: Incredible Panang curry and definitely some of the best service I've experienced in a while. 11/10 would recommend.
author: Nikhil B.
