description: I live around the area, so I was really hoping this place would be good, but I was disappointed. I got chicken pad see yew takeout. The chicken was questionable, the sauce was average, and it altogether wasn't very good. I've had much better elsewhere.
author: Margo C.

description:
BEWARE: 18% GRATUITY ADDED TO PARTY OF 4 ADULTS & 2 SMALL CHILDREN"

The employees were courteous and we would have left a big tip but we felt kind of cheated when they added that amount to the bill. 

The food was not bad. But since it's pricier than so many other options available there not sure we would go back.
author: Shals S.

description:
This is honestly one of the best restaurants I've been in a while.  The servers were very patient with me as I didn't know what to order, they suggested some dishes according to my preferences and WOW.  I had the sausages... enjoyed every bit. I had never had anything like it before.  The coconut curry was also great, I asked it to be not too spicy and it came to just my liking. 

As a new restaurant, I was also impressed with the service.  They were fast, friendly, and gave me great suggestions.  

Overall - highly recommend.
author: Ming L.

description: I ordered a noodle soup yesterday night! It was so bad, and i can't even eat another spoon!
author: Lina W.

description: Ordered delivery and it took over an hour and a half. The panang curry tasted ok but the meat was poor quality and there weren't any vegetables. I order curry all the time so this came as a surprise to me. The Pad Kee Mao was also just okay. I'm sorry to say, but I had higher expectations for this place.
author: Ashley C.

description: Great location and fresh thai food. Everything was delicious! Good ambiance, too. I think the bar area would be really fun to grab drinks and watch sports during the day time.
author: Ameena G.

description: Eggplant appetizer is amazing. Thai ice tea with vodka was outstanding. Food is fresh, service is getting there. Owner is awesome. Love this place and I'm worried about the free delivery.... I may end up ordering far too often.
author: Kate S.

description: Coming from NYC and being spoiled by a variety of restaurants and cuisines, we absolutely loved the food! Very fresh and delicious! The service is impeccable. I'd definitely come back if I return to SF. I would recommend this local Thai gem to anyone who is looking for great and succulent food experience.
author: Elina B.

description:
No one is going to say that King of Thai was great food, but it was edible and the cheap drinks and friendly service were the reason to go.  I had dinner at Tamarind Hall last night and the phrase, "lipstick on a pig" comes to mind.  
While the fresh coat of paint and updated bar are a nice upgrade, everything else has gone downhill.  The drink are no longer cheap, rather they are slightly more expensive than other options in the neighborhood. The service is poor, and despite the place being mostly empty our food took forever.
When we get to the food is where the one star review kicks in.  Or soup was luke warm and the noodles not cooked properly.  The broth was weak and had a musty and the chicken flavorless.  Flavorful authentic Thai food this was not.  More of a gross halfhearted attempt at Asian like soup.   My salmon curry was terrible.  The fish was dry and very over cooked.  The curry sauce was strange and quickly separated into oil and something strange.  It was hard to eat.  
Bottom line is that there is no reason to go here.  If you are looking for Thai food, pretty much anything else in the area is much better and cheaper.  If you are looking for a bar, there are many other better options in the neighborhood.  The new owners have taken something mediocre and made it awful.
author: Derek n.

description: Excellent restaurant! Great location, the food is amazing and authentic, the drinks were tasty, and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful! Love the artwork too! Great place to get both a casual dinner or even bring a date!
author: Brian F.

description: Good cocktail and food, but the service was bad. My waitress never asked if everything was OK or if I wanted anything else. She brought me the bill right after I got my food, then pressured me to pay her before I was done eating, so that she could close out. If she had explained earlier, I might have been more understanding. But she even took my plate and silverware before I was done eating. At thirty dollars for a drink and two appetizers, I'd expect better.
author: P S.

description:
Not your average Thai restaurant. It used to be a hole in the wall bar but it has been transformed into a cool, and unique eatery with interesting food and fabulous cocktails (try the Thai Me Up and the G-Spot). The salads are awesome and flavorful with fresh ingredients and the salmon salad alone is reason to come here. 

Stay away from the crab rice. it is disappointing and over priced but everything else was so good it was easily forgiven and forgotten.
author: Mahalo M.

description: Yummy and very fast!!! The panang curry with shrimp was perfect. Thai tea was a little too sweet.
author: Erica A.

description: 5 for food. It was delicious and good size portions. 2 for service. Ordered 3 dishes.. 1 came out after about 10-15 minutes. Then the next one came without the tofu we ordered. The bus girl noticed something was wrong.. We told her and she took it back. Waitress never  stopped by to apologize, discuss what happened.  The third dish we asked about three times before it came. No one other than the bus girl checked in with us... She was great about refilling water.
author: Debbie H.

description:
Tamarind Hall is pretentious. The new 'owners' have their thumbs in literally EVERYTHING which is not a good thing.. 
King Of Thai was a great place. The food and drinks were good and prices were great. 
With this new version of Thai in the same location the food is bland and a bit too pricey for what I think they're trying to convey to the crowd they want to cater to.
 
The new owners have pushed out the neighborhood regulars in an effort to cater to a less than 'diverse' crowd. I've seen the owner intentionally pick arguments with some of the old regulars (who I know for a fact welcomed her with open arms), get rid of the happy hour & raise drink prices several times in an effort to get them to move on. I've talked to a great many of the old King Of Thai regulars from the neighborhood and almost all of them have said they don't feel welcome and will not go back to Tamarind Hall...
In all honesty, I highly recommend finding a Thai restaurant withh tastier food and is more down to earth..
 This place now SUCKS.
author: Jane D.

description: We loved this restaurant. We had really delicious, fresh and innovative Thai food. The Yam Makua Yao and Mango Salad were especially flavorful and yummy. The prices are really fair too. We also found the staff to be very attentive and prompt even with a full house. The manager was super sweet and accommodating. She has a lovely presence. We will definitely be back!
author: Julie P.

description: The absolute worse service I have ever had! The waitress was sitting on her boyfriend's lap in between taking our order and it took us 25 minutes to even get water. Our food arrived in an hour and they forgot one of the dishes. The food was bland and not worth the wait. Absolutely terrible experience!!
author: Emm B.

description: We found this place one Friday after deciding we wanted some noodles. The server was super friendly and attentive, joking around with us and giving us recommendations. I got the Pad Woon Sen, a unique choice that I've never seen on a menu at a Thai restaurant despite having years of experience enthusiastically trying out Thai restaurants. The presentation of the food was almost too beautiful to eat and it was delicious too, although the portions were kind of small. I was still quite hungry after finishing my entire plate and for what I paid, I would've liked to see a more substantial portion. Still, a great choice - I'd definitely go back.
author: Aditi P.

description: Fairly good Panang curry and a dope vibe. They did how ever give us half chicken and tofu for the pad Thai made that unappealing all together.
author: Chance W.

description: Underwhelming food. Curries were watery, kind of diluted. Taste was lacking. Prices were over average for Thai restaurants in the city. Really can't understand how is currently rated at 4* in Yelp.
author: Fernando C.

description: Gai Yang Som Tum chicken was cold, like refrigerator cold.  Not coming back.  Service so slow too
author: Christine N.

description: Server was on the lap of some guy the whole time and only came over to help went we talked with someone else...
author: Joe S.

description: Loved the food in this thai joint. They have a lot of dishes that are not typically found in thai restaurants in the bay area. We absolutely loved their knockout wing and the umami rice. The pad thai wrapped in omelet was loved by our little one too. Definitely recommended. Cheers
author: Deepak K.

description: The spring rolls are fresh and delicious. Good beer selection helps the place feel very modern. The massaman curry was good but could have used a bit more spice. Overall very friendly staff and neat place to eat or have drinks.
author: Zoë L.

description: Went here for lunch and will no way be going back. Service was terrible and slow. I ordered the  Pad Kee Mow which was just meh. I asked for spicy and it was lacking heat.  After living in Thailand for 4 months I can tell you this is not authentic Thai food. The beef someone in our group ordered was a questionable grey color and tasted nothing like beef.  To add to this, it is way over priced for Thai food. Needless to say, this is nothing like the old King of Thai and I will not be returning.
author: S K.

description: My friends and I went to Tamarind Hall before seeing a show at the Punchline on a Saturday night, and it was excellent! The service was impeccable; the food mouth-watering. It's also a great location, right in North Beach, with great people watching if you get a window table. For appetizers, we tried the Yam Makua Yao, and Yum Kai Dao, both of which were full of flavor, and nothing like I've ever tried before. The duck eggs in both of the dishes were fantastic. For the main course, I tried the Massaman curry with beef, which was classically delicious and satisfying. My boyfriend got the Basil Eggplant dish, which was AMAZING! Seriously, you should try this. The normally humble eggplant was so full of flavor in this dish. I am getting this next time, which will be soon. I wouldn't be surprised to find a dish from this restaurant on the 7x7 top 100 things to eat in the Bay Area on the next iteration. Go try this place. You will not regret it!
author: Kendra B.

description: Wings were amazing (knockout wings).  Panang Curry, pad see ew, fried chicken fried rice, fried calamari.  Amazing.  Been to Thailand and matches the quality of food.  Amazing atmosphere.  Owner salisa is a great host.
author: Mikhael G.

description: The most incredible wings I've ever had (knockout wings).  Super nice service.  The main chef/owner is amazing.
author: Danielle B.

description: Worst Thai food I've had. Very dry, no flavor. The Tad Pai which is a specialty had no flavor, little to no vegetables, meat or sauce.  The spring rolls were flavorless as well. Overall very disappointing
author: Kris L.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city! This restaurant is great for big groups - I came here with a big group of friends and we ordered family style so everyone got to try a variety of dishes from their menu. The food was simply amazing! My favorite was the Khao Soy Gai. I'd also recommend all their larb (salad) dishes. Everything tasted delicious and authentic. On top of that, the staff was very friendly, helpful, and professional. Overall, I had a very great experience and will definitely be coming back for more authentic Thai food!
author: H C.

description: Good food, but it's definitely more of a sports bar than a Thai restaurant. It wasn't at all what I was expecting and don't recommend it unless you're looking for a very loud bar with tv monitors everywhere.
author: Danielle B.

description: Came here last night for drinks and roti - both were amazing.  The Thai Mango Mojito is perfect - sweet and flavorful. The roti was also a good complement.  I was on my way somewhere, but will definitely come back another time for the dishes, which look great.  It's so refreshing to find a place that is not traditional North Beach fare - makes me like it more.  I also like the diverse clientele - from men getting drunk at the bar watching basketball to a couple dining with infant at a table with friends to college gfs meeting up...this restaurant has something for everyone - a great way to bring different people together.  Service was extremely attentive. :)
author: Kate R.

description: Excellent choice for authentic Thai food and great cocktails!  The wait staff is attentive and the bar tenders are skilled.  This place is the perfect balance of dining and drinking, I'll visit when I'm the mood for Thai food or just want to grab drinks with friends.
author: mike k.

description: Great atmosphere, delicious food and tasty cocktails - Very excited to have the new place in the neighborhood!
author: Joel J.

description: Want to like it better, being a small neighborhood rest. Problem is, the food is a bit brown and ragged 'round the edges and, much worse, the waiter used a fork to pick at his fingers during a quiet moment. He then put the fork back at the place setting where he'd found it. Yipes.
author: Pavel P.

description: 3.5 stars- We ordered the chicken wings and they tasted good but were on the oily side. The curry roti dip was very good but served in a small portion. The tom kha ghai was good but not the best I have had.
author: H K.

description: Phenomenal food. The best Thai I've had outside of Thailand. The Penang curry was perfect.
author: Michael S.

description:
I visited Tamarind Hall multiple times when it first opened. So I would like to start the review off saying that the food was phenomenal, the service used to be great. I tried everything on the menu from the curry to the more traditional kha soi, all were great. 

However, this review is for when I visited Tamarind Hall again with a group of friends on Saturday night last week. We had a spot at the bar and it was crowded. The bartenders (not the owner who is so sweet) did not acknowledge us for ~20 mins. When one of us finally got their attention and asked for drinks and water, they did not bring us water for the next 30 mins. In total, between all of us, we asked the bartender for water at least 3 times. Each time, she would glare at us. This is on top of my drink order taking 30 mins. I watched as they served other people and even had time to file glasses in the back between the 2 bartenders. I think the service was just abhorrent. In addition, I asked the host if he would tell us when one of the larger tables left, so we could sit down. Instead, we left to find all of the tables completely empty and cleaned and no one let us know. I felt compelled to write this review so that the owner would know and make sure this doesn't happen to other customers.
author: A B.

description: Love this place. They put total effort into everything. The Laab Gai and Yam Makua Yao are my favorites. It's also a great place to watch sports, an added plus.
author: Peter W.

description: Excellent Thai food! Was in town on business and happened to be walking right up Columbus when I found this place on Yelp!  Stopped for dinner based on the great reviews. The Fresh Roll was light and, well, fresh. The peanut sauce complemented it perfectly. Pad Thai was steaming hot with just enough tang. Service was friendly and efficient. Definitely recommend eating here.
author: Kenneth N.

description: Incredibly good food, and great service. Everything we've tried is great... the "mango salad" is to die for! Our only complaint was that they weren't open later, and now they are!!!
author: Celeste S.

description: Loved the food at TH. Eggplant salad, chicken drumstick noodle soup, chicken satay and roti curry were all 5 star quality. Will go there again soon for authentic Thai food and Old fashioned whiskey!
author: Subir A.

description: Ordered a spread of dishes from the spiced ribeye (Nam Dtok Nuer) to the grilled eggplant and off-menu salmon ceviche, and each dish was hit-the-spot tasty.  The owners are warm and hands-on, passionate about getting the best ingredients, and eager for feedback on making things better.  On my short list of go-to spots now.
author: Tony L.

description: Tamarind Hall is a lovely new eatery that stands out, in a neighborhood that caters to volume tourist trade, as an up and coming outstanding local haunt.  The ambience is inviting, food both tasty and beautifully presented, and the prices quite reasonable.  I'll be back for more.
author: S M.

description: Great food at a great price. Couldn't ask for more. You definitely have to try their signature drinks.
author: Tim C.

description: Full bar, fun menu, American Thai standards and some northern dishes too. The server recommended the salmon yellow curry and I was not disappointed.
author: Steve P.

description: This place was absolutely incredible. Me and my friends got a ton of stuff on the menu and sampled everything. It was all amazing!! The mango mojito is a MUST!
author: Nathan C.

description: This place is nothing close to being fresh and organic. You could tell by the quality of the  ingredients. The only think good about it is the way the dishes are being plated. Even so I believe they are basically copied what is going on at another Thai joint called Farmhouse Kitchen which has opened way longer. I have been traveling to Thailand for years and Tamarind Hall is nothing near the dishes I had in Thailand. I would not be back, however, I do think the bar girls are pretty good looking. Wings**
author: Drew W.

description:
My 5 stars goes for the "flavor" !! I am an Indian and my exposure to Thai food has been limited to local Thai restaurants in Bay Area. Everything that i ate here was so full of flavor, that  the Thai food  that i have eaten so far seems to be fake.  
It is truly an authentic restaurant mixed with a fun sports bar kind of an environment. 
The owner, Salisa made an effort to guide us through the menu and helped us pick her best stuff. 
We had Curry/Roti dip and the dips are to die for. These were the best dip i have ever tasted in a Thai restaurant. 
Yam Makua Yao - on Salisa's recommendation. This dish has taken eggplant to whole new level. 
Khao Soy Gai -once again on the owner's recommendation. This is a big bowl of soup (too big to be a meal in itself) and it was one of the things where the taste lingers on. 
When they say, they have tried to recreate simple Thai street food, they mean it. The owners hard work shows in the taste- everything tasted fresh, made from scratch and that is what leads to a lingering taste. 

My "must go to" place to satisfy my Thai food craving each time i am in SF.
author: Meenakshi P.

description: Very good and authentic modern thai food. Good service and the atmosphere is nice. Reasonable pricing.
author: Teddy M.

description: We sat for about 15 minutes before our waitress greeted us. We ordered two cocktails and one beer and request she come back in about 10 minutes. About 20 minutes later I had to flag down someone(not our waitress) to request our food order be taken. About 10 minutes later, our waitress appears to take our order. Our order is taken, we inquire about our drinks and told "they're coming up." About 20 minutes later two of the three dishes come out settled(having sat for too long). Still no beer or cocktails. They cocked up the third order and hadn't done the drinks yet. Our waitress is a bad liar; second waitress gets everything done. We didn't end up getting a Sapporo and two cocktails until ten minutes after our meal, which took a sum total of 35 minutes to get correctly. This isn't including the extra 10 I had to wait after both of my friends got their food. They took a simple, straightforward restaurant that felt good and made it overly fanciful and clunky. They're trying to elevate Thai food, which I celebrate and think they should; but are dropping the ball. If you want to make something pricier and fancier then it needs to be that.
author: Luis G.

description: i ordered chicken with pumpkin curry.  there was no chicken in the dish. they sent it back and brought me another dish but the chicken was  undercooked and only warm. The pumpkin was also undercooked. Drinks were expensive. We had three drinks each, at $10-12. Very little alcohol.  There are much better options.  We could not read menu because it was too dark. owner was very nice. but food was not worth it.  too much msg. very salty. maybe you will have better luck.
author: Real O.
